## 2025-11-07 03:30 ‚Äî Alexis: Deep Persona Research Analysis + Improvement Plan ‚úÖ

**Work:** Analyzed comprehensive Upwork persona research document and extracted all actionable insights

**Critical Discovery: Business Buyers vs Technical Buyers Are COMPLETELY DIFFERENT**

**Business Buyer Psychology:**
1. **Time Poverty Syndrome** - Living in "fire drill" mode, no time for long proposals
2. **Imposter Syndrome** - Fear of approving "bad" work that makes them look incompetent
3. **Results-First** - Don't care about process (AI, tools, methodology), only care about outcome
4. **Budget Anxiety** - Fear of surprise costs, scope creep, being ripped off
5. **Reputation Fear** - "Will my boss/client think this is professional?"
6. **Decision Fatigue** - Don't want more decisions, want someone to figure it out

**Technical Buyer Psychology:**
1. **Scope Creep PTSD** - Burned by projects that ballooned from $500 to $2000
2. **Trust Deficit** - Seen fake portfolios, hired "experts" who couldn't code
3. **Process-Oriented** - WANT methodology (Git, testing, documentation)
4. **Technical Credibility** - Will ask technical questions to vet you
5. **Risk Aversion** - Worried about code breaking in production, security holes
6. **Communication Frustration** - Need transparency, regular updates, no surprises

**Website Improvements (Based on Research):**

**Homepage (Business Buyers):**
- ‚ùå REMOVE: "Executable acceptance criteria" (technical jargon)
- ‚úÖ ADD: "Professional Creative Work. Delivered in Days, Not Weeks." (outcome + speed)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Visual portfolio with before/after examples (addresses imposter syndrome)
- ‚úÖ ADD: "Trusted by" section with client logos/anonymized proof (addresses reputation fear)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Simplified services grid with icons (scannable, not text-heavy)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Business-friendly FAQ (5-6 questions addressing common fears)
- ‚úÖ ADD: 3 CTAs ("Get Free Estimate," "See Our Work," "Schedule Call") not just 1

**Separate Process Page (Technical Buyers):**
- ‚úÖ KEEP: AC.md, Evidence Sprint, AC Green (this is their love language)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Technical stack details (Next.js, FastAPI, PostgreSQL)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Quality gates (testing, Lighthouse scores, code review)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Technical FAQ (version control, testing, integrations)
- ‚úÖ ADD: Proof log link (commits, AC green tags)

**Proposal Improvements:**

**Business Buyer Template (200-300 words):**
```
Hi [Name],
I'll create [deliverable] in [timeline].

What you'll get:
‚úì [Item 1]
‚úì [Item 2]
‚úì 2 revision rounds included

Timeline: [X] days
Price: $[Y] fixed (no surprise costs)

Here's similar work: [visual sample link]

Ready to start?
```

**Technical Buyer Template (400-600 words):**
```
Hi [Name],
I'll build [system] using [tech stack].

Technical approach:
- [Component 1]
- [Component 2]

Deliverables (AC.md):
‚úì [Feature 1 - testable]
‚úì [Feature 2 - testable]
‚úì Unit + integration tests
‚úì Documentation

Process:
- Git version control
- Test-driven development
- Daily updates

Timeline: [X] weeks
Price: $[Y] fixed
- Milestone 1: $[Z]
- Milestone 2: $[Z]

My GitHub: [link]

Questions:
- [Technical Q1]
- [Technical Q2]
```

**Pricing Strategy Insights:**

**Business Buyers:**
- Fixed price ALWAYS (hourly triggers anxiety)
- Tiered packages (Basic $400 / Standard $600 / Premium $900)
- "Most Popular" badge on middle tier (addresses decision fatigue)
- Transparent "what's included" (addresses budget anxiety)

**Technical Buyers:**
- Fixed price with milestones (prevents scope creep)
- Payment per milestone (risk reduction)
- Testable deliverables (objective success criteria)
- Never underprice (they'll think you don't understand scope)

**Communication Insights:**

**Business Buyers:**
- Daily reassurance ("making progress")
- No action required from them
- Fast responses (<2 hours)
- Friendly, professional tone

**Technical Buyers:**
- Daily technical progress updates
- Transparency about challenges
- Ask questions proactively
- Provide code access (GitHub branches)

**Critical Action Items (Week 1):**
1. Hero rewrite (1 hour, 20-30% impact)
2. Add "Trusted by" section (2 hours, 15-20% impact)
3. Create business buyer proposal template (1 hour, 10-15% win rate increase)
4. Add business buyer FAQ (2 hours, 10-15% reduction in objections)

**Metrics to Track:**
- Homepage bounce rate: Target <40%
- CTA click-through: Target >15%
- Proposal win rate: Target 25-30%
- Average project value: Target $600-800

**Status:** ‚úÖ Complete
**Next:** Incorporate insights into Website Improvement Plan, update Emma's proposal templates

**Link:** `/home/mind-protocol/scopelock/citizens/alexis/PERSONA_INSIGHTS_AND_IMPROVEMENTS.md`

messages.content:
## ‚úÖ Complete Persona Research Analysis

I've analyzed the comprehensive Upwork persona research document and extracted all insights and improvement propositions. Here's the summary:

---

## **CRITICAL DISCOVERY: Two Completely Different Languages**

Business Buyers and Technical Buyers are NOT variations of the same person‚Äîthey speak entirely different languages and have opposite psychologies.

### **Business Buyer ("The Overwhelmed Marketer")**
**Core Psychology:**
1. **Time Poverty** - Living in "fire drill" mode, drowning in to-do lists
2. **Imposter Syndrome** - "I don't know what good looks like, what if I approve something terrible?"
3. **Results-First** - Don't care HOW you do it, only WHAT you deliver
4. **Budget Anxiety** - "Am I being ripped off? What if costs balloon?"
5. **Reputation Fear** - "Will this make me look good to my boss/clients?"
6. **Decision Fatigue** - Making 100+ decisions/day, want someone to figure it out

**What They Want:**
- SHORT proposals (200-300 words max)
- VISUAL portfolio (see what "good" looks like)
- FIXED pricing (no hourly - too unpredictable)
- FAST delivery ("delivered in 3 days")
- Someone to DECIDE for them (recommend, don't ask questions)

**What Triggers Them:**
‚úÖ "Fast turnaround," "Done-for-you," "Fixed price: $600 - no surprise costs"
‚ùå "Hourly rate," "We can discuss scope after," "It depends on complexity"

---

### **Technical Buyer ("The Process-Oriented CTO")**
**Core Psychology:**
1. **Scope Creep PTSD** - Burned by projects that ballooned from $500 to $2000
2. **Trust Deficit** - Seen fake portfolios, hired "experts" who couldn't code
3. **Process-Oriented** - WANT to know methodology (Git, testing, documentation)
4. **Technical Credibility Obsession** - Will ask technical questions to vet you
5. **Risk Aversion** - Worried about code breaking, security holes, technical debt

**What They Want:**
- DETAILED proposals (400-600 words with technical depth)
- GITHUB links (prove you can code)
- ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA upfront (objective success metrics)
- PROCESS details (Git, testing, documentation)
- REALISTIC pricing (low-balls are red flags)

**What Triggers Them:**
‚úÖ "Fixed price with milestones," "AC.md contract," "GitHub: [link]," "Unit + integration tests"
‚ùå "I can build your SaaS in 1 week for $500," Generic proposals, No process mentioned

---

## **WEBSITE IMPROVEMENT PROPOSITIONS**

### **Homepage (Target: Business Buyers)**

**Current Problems:**
- Hero says "executable acceptance criteria" (technical jargon - they don't know what this means)
- No visual portfolio (they need to see "what good looks like")
- Only one CTA (limits conversion paths)
- Long explanations of process (they don't care)

**Proposed Fixes:**

**1. Hero Rewrite**
```
CURRENT:
"Software locked to executable acceptance criteria"

RECOMMENDED:
"Professional Creative Work. Delivered in Days, Not Weeks."

Subheader: "AI-powered presentations, voiceovers, translations, and content.
10√ó faster than traditional agencies. Fixed pricing. 2 revisions included."

CTAs:
- "Get Free Estimate" (primary - low friction)
- "See Our Work" (secondary - portfolio)
- "Schedule 15-min Call" (tertiary - personal touch)
```

**Impact:** 20-30% increase in engagement (addresses time poverty, budget anxiety, decision fatigue)

---

**2. Add Visual Portfolio Section**
```
Show before/after examples:
- Pitch deck samples (Gamma)
- Social media graphics (Ideogram)
- Blog post samples (content writing)
- Voiceover demos (ElevenLabs)

Each with:
- Visual preview
- Client type ("SaaS startup")
- Result metric ("Closed $500K round")
```

**Impact:** 20-25% increase in trust (addresses imposter syndrome - shows what "good" looks like)

---

**3. Add "Trusted By" Section**
```
IF logos allowed:
[TherapyKin] [KinKong] [La Serenissima]

IF confidential:
"Trusted by 8+ startups in AI, healthcare, fintech"
- AI companion (121+ deployments, 1.2M interactions)
- Trading infrastructure ($75K AUM)
- Multi-agent orchestration (97 agents, 99.7% uptime)
```

**Impact:** 15-20% increase in trust (addresses reputation fear - if others trusted you, I can too)

---

**4. Simplify Services Section**
```
Visual grid with icons (not text-heavy):

[Icon] Presentations & PDFs
Create investor decks, sales presentations
Starting at $400 | 4-8 hours | Get Quote

[Icon] Voice & Audio
Voiceovers for videos, audiobooks, podcasts
Starting at $300 | 4-8 hours | Get Quote

(etc. for all creative AI services)
```

**Impact:** 15-20% increase in clarity (addresses decision fatigue - scannable, not overwhelming)

---

**5. Add Business Buyer FAQ**
```
Q: What if I don't like the samples?
A: We'll create new samples in a different style. You only pay when you're happy.

Q: Can I request revisions?
A: Yes! 2 revision rounds included. Additional revisions $50 each (rarely needed).

Q: How fast can you deliver?
A: Most creative projects delivered in 3-7 days. Rush delivery (2 days) available for +30%.
```

**Impact:** 10-15% reduction in questions/objections

---

### **Separate "Process" Page (Target: Technical Buyers)**

**Purpose:** Keep technical details OFF homepage (overwhelms business buyers), but available for technical buyers who WANT it.

**Content:**
- AC.md methodology deep dive
- Tech stack details (Next.js, FastAPI, PostgreSQL)
- Quality gates (testing, Lighthouse scores)
- Technical FAQ
- Proof log link

**Impact:** Technical buyers get what they need, business buyers aren't confused

---

## **PROPOSAL IMPROVEMENT PROPOSITIONS**

### **Business Buyer Template (Emma Uses This)**

**Current Problems:**
- Too long
- Too much technical detail
- Asks too many questions

**Recommended Template (200-300 words):**
```
Hi [Name],

I'll create [specific deliverable] in [realistic timeline].

What you'll get:
‚úì [Deliverable 1]
‚úì [Deliverable 2]
‚úì [Deliverable 3]
‚úì 2 revision rounds included

Timeline: [X] days
Price: $[Y] fixed (no surprise costs)

Here's similar work I created: [link to visual sample]

I can start immediately and have the first samples to you by [date].

Ready to get started?

Best,
ScopeLock Team
```

**Impact:** 10-15% increase in win rate (short, outcome-focused, fixed price, visual sample)

---

### **Technical Buyer Template (Emma Uses This)**

**Recommended Template (400-600 words):**
```
Hi [Name],

I'll build [specific system] using [tech stack].

I've built [X] similar systems. Example: [link to live demo]

Technical approach:
- [Component 1 with tech choice]
- [Component 2 with tech choice]
- [Component 3 with tech choice]

Deliverables (AC.md):
‚úì [Feature 1 - testable]
‚úì [Feature 2 - testable]
‚úì Unit + integration tests
‚úì Documentation

Process:
- Git version control with feature branches
- Test-driven development
- Daily progress updates

Timeline: [X] weeks (realistic)
Price: $[Y] fixed
- Milestone 1: $[Z]
- Milestone 2: $[Z]

My GitHub: [link]

Questions:
- [Technical question showing understanding]
- [Technical question showing understanding]

Best,
ScopeLock Team
```

**Impact:** Builds credibility, addresses scope creep fear, shows systematic approach

---

## **PRICING STRATEGY INSIGHTS**

### **Business Buyers:**
- ‚úÖ Fixed price ALWAYS (hourly triggers anxiety)
- ‚úÖ Tiered packages (Basic / Standard / Premium)
- ‚úÖ "Most Popular" badge on middle tier (addresses decision fatigue)
- ‚ùå NEVER hourly for fixed-scope creative work

### **Technical Buyers:**
- ‚úÖ Fixed price with milestones (prevents scope creep)
- ‚úÖ Payment per milestone (risk reduction)
- ‚ùå NEVER underprice (they'll think you don't understand scope)

---

## **CRITICAL ACTION ITEMS (Week 1)**

**Priority 1: Homepage Hero Rewrite**
- Effort: 1 hour
- Impact: 20-30% increase in engagement
- Change "executable acceptance criteria" ‚Üí "Professional Creative Work. Delivered in Days, Not Weeks."

**Priority 2: Add "Trusted By" Section**
- Effort: 2 hours
- Impact: 15-20% increase in trust
- Client logos OR anonymized social proof

**Priority 3: Business Buyer Proposal Template**
- Effort: 1 hour
- Impact: 10-15% increase in win rate
- Emma uses for all creative AI proposals

**Priority 4: Business Buyer FAQ**
- Effort: 2 hours
- Impact: 10-15% reduction in objections
- 5-6 questions addressing common fears

---

## **Files Created**

- `/home/mind-protocol/scopelock/citizens/alexis/PERSONA_INSIGHTS_AND_IMPROVEMENTS.md` ‚úÖ (8000+ words, complete analysis)
- `/home/mind-protocol/scopelock/citizens/SYNC.md` ‚úÖ Updated

---

**The Bottom Line:**

Business Buyers and Technical Buyers are **two different people** who need **two different websites**, **two different proposals**, and **two different communication styles**.

Right now, our website/proposals try to serve both, which means we serve neither well.

**The fix:** Homepage targets Business Buyers (bigger budgets, faster decisions, higher margins). Separate Process page targets Technical Buyers (keep them happy, don't lose this audience).

# ScopeLock Website Improvement Plan V2 (Business Buyers Only)

**Created:** 2025-11-07
**Owner:** Alexis (Strategic Operations)
**Revised Based On:** Nicolas feedback - solo founder voice, business buyers only, include development services

---

## KEY CONSTRAINTS

1. **Solo founder voice** - Use "I" (Nicolas), NOT "we" or "agency"
2. **Target ONLY business buyers** - Forget technical buyers for now
3. **Include BOTH services:**
   - Creative AI services (presentations, voice, images, music, translation, content)
   - Development services (websites, AI chatbots, web apps, integrations)
4. **Use existing portfolio** - Nicolas's live websites + GitHub projects
5. **NO phone calls** - Don't waste time on calls
6. **NO testimonials yet** - Don't have them
7. **NO "Trusted By" section yet** - Need client permissions first
8. **NO separate Process page** - Emma handles technical proposals differently

---

## HOMEPAGE IMPROVEMENTS (Business Buyer Focus)

### 1. Hero Section Rewrite

**CURRENT:**
```
"Software locked to executable acceptance criteria"
"I write tests with you, you pay only when tests pass"
"Solo engineer + AI team. 65k commits in 2024."
CTA: "Start with Evidence Sprint"
```

**PROBLEMS:**
- "Executable acceptance criteria" = jargon (business buyers don't know what this means)
- Focus on process, not outcome
- Only one CTA
- No mention of creative services

**RECOMMENDED:**
```
Hero H1: "Professional Software & Creative Work. Delivered Fast."

Hero pitch: "I build websites, AI chatbots, and web apps. I also create presentations,
voiceovers, translations, and content using AI. Fixed pricing. Fast delivery.
You pay only when it works."

Subtext: "Solo developer + AI-assisted workflow. 65k commits in 2024. 121+ deployments."

CTAs:
- "Get Free Estimate" (primary - AI-powered form)
- "See My Work" (secondary - portfolio page)
```

**Why this works:**
- Mentions BOTH services (development + creative AI)
- Outcome-focused ("delivered fast")
- Solo voice ("I build," not "we build")
- Multiple CTAs
- Risk reversal ("pay only when it works")
- Credibility ("65k commits, 121+ deployments")

**Implementation:**
- Effort: 1 hour
- Owner: Nicolas (or whoever updates website)

---

### 2. Services Section (Split: Development + Creative)

**CURRENT:**
Text-heavy descriptions, no clear structure

**RECOMMENDED:**
Visual grid with icons, split into two categories

**DEVELOPMENT SERVICES:**

```
[Icon: Code] Web Development
Build landing pages, web apps, SaaS products
Starting at $200 | 2-7 days | Next.js + Vercel

[Icon: Robot] AI Chatbot Integration
Add AI chat to your website or app
Starting at $400 | 3-7 days | OpenAI/Claude API

[Icon: Database] Backend APIs

**CREATIVE AI SERVICES:**

```

Starting at $400 | 1-3 days | AI-powered design

[Icon: Voice] Voice & Audio
Voiceovers for videos, audiobooks, podcast intros
Starting at $300 | 1-3 days | ElevenLabs AI

[Icon: Globe] Translation
Translate your website, app, or content to 50+ languages
Starting at $500 | 2-5 days | Claude AI

[Icon: Pen] Content Writing
SEO blog posts, product descriptions, email campaigns
Starting at $600 | 2-5 days | AI-assisted writing

[Icon: Image] Images & Graphics
Product images, social media graphics, marketing materials
Starting at $400 | 1-3 days | Ideogram AI

[Icon: Music] Music & Sound
Background music, podcast intros, custom jingles
Starting at $300 | 1-3 days | Suno/Udio AI
```

**Why this works:**
- Shows BOTH development AND creative services
- Scannable (addresses decision fatigue)
- Fixed pricing visible (addresses budget anxiety)
- Fast timelines (addresses time poverty)
- Specific tools mentioned (builds credibility)

**Implementation:**
- Effort: 3-4 hours (design + copy)
- Owner: Nicolas (or whoever updates website)

---

### 3. "How It Works" Section (Business-Friendly, No Calls)

**CURRENT:**
AC.md ‚Üí Evidence Sprint ‚Üí AC Green (technical jargon)

**RECOMMENDED:**

```
HOW I WORK

1. YOU DESCRIBE WHAT YOU NEED (Day 1)
   Send me a message or fill out the estimate form. I'll confirm I understand
   and give you a fixed price + timeline.

2. I CREATE SAMPLES (Days 2-3)

3. I DELIVER THE FULL PROJECT (Days 4-7)
   I complete the rest based on your approved samples/demo.
   You get daily updates (no need to check in).

4. YOU TEST & PAY WHEN SATISFIED (Day 8+)
   Test everything. Request changes if needed (2 revision rounds included).
   You only pay when you're completely happy.
```

**Why this works:**
- Solo voice ("I create," not "we create")
- No phone calls mentioned (just message or form)

- Emphasizes speed (day numbers)
- Risk reversal ("pay only when satisfied")
- For development AND creative (mentions both)

**Implementation:**

- Owner: Alexis (draft copy) ‚Üí Nicolas (approve)

**Implementation:**

### 6. FAQ Section (Business Buyer Focus)

**RECOMMENDED:**

```
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Q: How fast can you deliver?
A: Most projects are delivered in 2-7 days. Simple projects (landing pages,

## 2. Key Technical Concepts

**Client Persona Psychology:**
- **Business Buyers ("The Overwhelmed Marketer"):**
  - Time Poverty Syndrome: Living in "fire drill" mode, no time for long proposals (200-300 words max)
  - Imposter Syndrome: Fear of approving "bad" work ("I don't know what 'good' looks like")
  - Results-First: Don't care about process (AI tools, methodology), only outcomes
  - Budget Anxiety: Fear of surprise costs, scope creep (fixed pricing required)
  - Reputation Fear: "Will this make me look good to my boss/clients?"
  - Decision Fatigue: Making 100+ decisions/day, want someone to figure it out
  
- **Technical Buyers ("The Process-Oriented CTO"):**
  - Scope Creep PTSD: Burned by projects ballooning from $500 to $2000
  - Trust Deficit: Seen fake portfolios, hired "experts" who couldn't code
  - Process-Oriented: WANT methodology details (Git, testing, documentation)
  - Technical Credibility: Will ask technical questions to vet competence
  - Risk Aversion: Worried about code breaking in production

- Emphasize both development AND creative services

**Pricing Models:**
- Development: $200-600 (landing pages, chatbots, APIs, document processing)
- Creative AI: $300-1500 (presentations, voice, translation, content, images, music)
- Always fixed price (addresses budget anxiety and scope creep fears)

  1. ScopeLock ‚Äî We co-write AC.md (acceptance criteria) and write the corresponding acceptance tests.

input.new_string:
How I Work

Simple 4-step process. No meetings required. Daily updates.

  1. You Describe What You Need (Day 1) ‚Äî Send me a message or fill out the estimate form. I'll confirm I understand and give you a fixed price + timeline.
  2. I Create Samples (Days 2-3) ‚Äî For creative work: I create 5-10 samples in your style. For development: I build a working demo or first feature. You approve or request changes.
  3. I Deliver the Full Project (Days 4-7) ‚Äî I complete the rest based on your approved samples/demo. You get daily updates (no need to check in).
  4. You Test & Pay When Satisfied (Day 8+) ‚Äî Test everything. Request changes if needed (2 revision rounds included). You only pay when you're completely happy.

Frequently Asked Questions

How fast can you deliver?

Most projects are delivered in 2-7 days. Simple projects (landing pages, presentations) in 2-3 days. Complex projects (web apps, integrations) in 5-7 days. Rush delivery (1-2 days) available for +30%.

What if I don't like the result?

You don't pay until you're happy. 2 revision rounds included. I'll keep revising until it meets your standards.

Do you work with agencies or outsource the work?

No. I do all the work myself, with AI assistance. No teams, no outsourcing. You work directly with me.

What's your pricing model?

Fixed price, quoted upfront. No hourly rates. No surprise costs. Development: $200-600. Creative services: $300-1500.

Can you start immediately?

Yes. Most projects I can start same day or next day.

Do you sign NDAs?

Yes, I'm happy to sign your NDA before we start.

What if my project is larger than your typical scope?

I can break it into smaller milestones. You pay per milestone, only when each milestone is delivered and tested.

1‚ÜíI know you're open to hourly or fixed-price - I work fixed-price milestones. You know cost upfront, pay only when demo works.

     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWe built Mind Protocol (graph-based knowledge substrate extracting relationships from unstructured data, github.com/mind-protocol/mind-protocol), La Serenissima (serenissima.ai - 97+ agents with 99.7% uptime, real-time orchestration with structured outputs), TherapyKin (therapykin.ai - Next.js subscription app with Supabase auth, Stripe, Vercel deployment). Verify at github.com/nlr-ai and github.com/mind-protocol (terminal-velocity 1.1k stars).
     6‚Üí
     7‚ÜíThe hard part is pipeline reliability and visualization. Your system needs to handle incomplete transcripts, ambiguous references, overlapping relationships. Then turn messy JSON into clean SVG diagrams users want to interact with.
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíMVP Phase 1 ($8,500 fixed, 8 weeks):
    10‚Üí1. Content ingestion - scrape/API-pull sports content, clean and chunk for LLM
    11‚Üí2. LLM extraction - GPT-4 structured outputs to JSON (entities, relationships), store in Postgres with embeddings in vector DB
    12‚Üí3. Visualization - convert JSON to interactive SVG (D3.js/React-SVG), zoom/pan/selection
    13‚Üí4. Web app - Next.js with Supabase auth, search, favorites, deploy Vercel
    14‚Üí5. Payments - Stripe subscription (test mode), user dashboard
    15‚Üí6. Test with 50-100 samples, 3 entity types, 5 relationship patterns
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíAcceptance - given sports content, system extracts at 85% accuracy, generates clean diagram, supports auth search, processes test subscription. If below 85% or diagrams unusable, I fix before you pay.
    18‚Üí
    19‚ÜíBefore start, we co-write acceptance criteria. What passes? Which content sources (podcasts, articles, transcripts)? Which entities matter (players, teams, events)? How measure extraction vs hallucination? You pay only when tests pass.
    20‚Üí
    21‚ÜíChanges mid-build: Swap (same complexity, no charge) or Add (new milestone, priced).
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíAfter Phase 1 proves pipeline, we scope Phase 2 (analytics, exports, mobile). You see it working before full commitment.

How ScopeLock Works

A deep dive into our delivery model.

The ScopeLock Flow

Most freelancing is based on time estimates ("this will take 2 weeks") or story points. ScopeLock locks the outcome instead.

Here's how:
input.new_string:
export default function ProcessPage() { return (

How I Work

Simple 4-step process. Fixed pricing. Fast delivery (2-7 days).

The Process

Most freelancers sell hours. Agencies sell phases. I deliver complete projects at fixed prices.

Here's how it works:

input.old_string:
1. ScopeLock Phase

We co-write AC.md (Acceptance Criteria) with you. This document defines:

  • Functional requirements: What the software must do
  • Non-functional requirements: Performance (p95 latency), quality (error rates), UX (steps to complete)
  • Verification: How we'll test it (e.g., Playwright tests, pytest, performance benchmarks)

Once AC.md is agreed, we lock it with a git tag: ac-baseline_*. Changes after this require a formal Change Request.

Example AC.md (click to expand) 
{`# Acceptance Criteria ‚Äî OTP Signup

## Functional

- User can sign up with email + OTP (no password)
- OTP sent via email within 5 seconds
- OTP valid for 10 minutes
- User redirected to dashboard after successful OTP entry
- Failed OTP shows clear error message

## Non-Functional

- **Performance:** p95 signup flow <300ms (server-side)
- **Quality:** Error rate <0.1% on OTP send
- **UX:** Signup completes in ‚â§3 steps (email ‚Üí OTP ‚Üí dashboard)

## Verification

**Command:**
\`\`\`bash
npm run test:acceptance -- signup.spec.ts
\`\`\`

**Seed data:**
- Test user: test@example.com
- Mock OTP provider (bypasses real email in CI)

**Pass criteria:**
- All Playwright tests green
- p95 latency measured <300ms (10 sample runs)
- Manual walkthrough: <90s from landing to dashboard`}
input.new_string:
Step 1: You Describe What You Need (Day 1)

Send me a message or fill out the contact form. Tell me what you need built or created.

Within 2 hours, I'll send you:

  • Fixed price ‚Äî Exact cost, no hourly billing
  • Timeline ‚Äî How many days (typically 2-7 days)
  • Deliverables ‚Äî What exactly you'll get

No obligation. If the price or timeline doesn't work, no hard feelings.

input.old_string:
2. Evidence Sprint

Before building the full feature, we produce evidence:

  • Demo ‚â§90s: A working prototype or proof-of-concept
  • DELTA.md: Quantified changes (e.g., "p95 reduced from 1200ms to 280ms")

This validates assumptions early. If the Evidence Sprint doesn't prove value, you can stop without committing to full delivery.

Evidence Sprints are tagged: evidence-sprint_feature_date and published to our Proof Log.
input.new_string:
Step 2: I Create Samples (Days 2-3)

I don't disappear for weeks. You see progress immediately.

For creative work: I create 5-10 samples in your style (presentations, designs, content). You approve the direction or request changes.

For development: I build a working demo or first feature. You can test it and give feedback.

This ensures we're aligned before I complete the full project.

input.old_string:
3. Build ‚Üí AC Green

We implement the feature, writing acceptance tests as we go. These tests verify the criteria in AC.md.

When all tests pass in CI/CD, we emit an ac-green_* tag. That's the completion signal. No subjective debate about "done."

At AC green:

  • We issue an invoice
  • You get production-ready code
  • Proof is published with tag, demo, delta, and tests
input.new_string:
Step 3: I Deliver the Full Project (Days 4-7)

Once you approve the samples/demo direction, I complete the rest.

You get daily updates without having to ask. No waiting in the dark wondering if anything is happening.

For development: Deployed to production (Vercel, Render, or your hosting). You get access immediately.

For creative work: All final files in the formats you need (PowerPoint, PDF, MP3, PNG, etc.).

input.old_string:
Change Control (CHG-130)

If scope changes after ac-baseline, we open a Change Request:

  • Swap: Replace existing scope with equal/lower complexity ‚Üí ‚Ç¨0, same milestone
  • Add: New scope beyond original AC ‚Üí new milestone, priced separately

Every CR is analyzed for size, risk, and impact. You decide whether to proceed.

CRs are tagged: change-req_*, and their status is visible in the Proof Log.
input.new_string:
Step 4: You Test & Pay When Satisfied (Day 8+)

Test everything. Use it. Click around. Read the content. Listen to the audio.

Need changes? 2 revision rounds included in the fixed price. I'll adjust until you're happy.

You only pay when you're completely satisfied. No "90% done" invoices. No surprise costs.

Once you approve, you pay and the project is officially complete.

input.old_string:
Proof Log (PRF-020)

Every milestone generates proof artifacts:

  • AC.md ‚Äî The acceptance criteria
  • DEMO.md ‚Äî Link to demo + 3-bullet summary
  • DELTA.md ‚Äî Quantified deltas (‚â•2 metrics)

These are compiled into a static Proof Log at build time. No runtime fetches, no embellishment‚Äîjust git tags and markdown.

Why This Works

For you:

  • Predictable pricing (no hourly creep)
  • Measurable outcomes (tests define done)
  • Evidence before commitment (Evidence Sprints)
  • Transparent progress (Proof Log)

For us:

  • Clear success criteria (AC.md)
  • No scope creep (Change Control)
  • Portfolio proof (every milestone is public)
input.new_string:
What If I Change My Mind Mid-Project?

You can request changes at any point:

  • Small changes: Included in the 2 revision rounds (no extra cost)
  • Different direction: If you want something different than originally quoted, I'll give you a new price for the changes. You decide if you want to proceed.

No surprise invoices. If it costs more, I tell you before doing the work.

Why This Works

For you:

  • Fixed pricing ‚Äî No hourly creep, no surprise costs
  • Fast delivery ‚Äî Most projects done in 2-7 days
  • See progress immediately ‚Äî Samples/demos in 2-3 days
  • Risk-free ‚Äî 2 revisions included, pay only when satisfied
  • Direct access ‚Äî You work with me (the architect), not account managers

For me:

  • Clear requirements ‚Äî I know exactly what you need upfront
  • No scope creep ‚Äî Changes are discussed and priced before work
  • Fair pricing ‚Äî Fixed price means I'm incentivized to work efficiently

input.old_string:

Traditional Freelancing

  • Sell hours or story points
  • "Done" is subjective
  • Scope creep common
  • No measurable deltas
  • Pay regardless of outcome

ScopeLock

  • Sell outcomes (AC green)
  • "Done" = tests pass in CI
  • Change Control (Swap/Add)
  • Quantified deltas required
  • Pay only at AC green

Ready to Lock Scope?

Schedule a kickoff See proof of delivery ‚Üí

Continue with the last task that you were asked to work on." **My action:** Implemented the complete Website Improvement Plan V2 that was created in the previous session: 1. **Hero Section Update** (`src/app/page.tsx` lines 19-34): - Changed H1 from "Software locked to executable acceptance criteria" to "Professional Software & Creative Work. Delivered Fast." - Updated pitch to include both development and creative services - Changed tagline to "Solo developer + AI-assisted workflow" - Updated CTAs to "Get Free Estimate" + "See My Work" 2. **Services Grid Addition** (lines 62-189): - Added complete 10-service grid - Development: Web Development ($200+), AI Chatbot Integration ($400+), Backend APIs ($300+), Document Processing ($400+) - Creative AI: Presentations ($400+), Voice & Audio ($300+), Translation ($500+), Content Writing ($600+), Images ($400+), Music ($300+) - Each with emoji icons, descriptions, pricing, timelines, tech stacks 3. **How I Work Section** (lines 191-210): - Changed from technical jargon (AC.md, Evidence Sprint, AC green) to business-friendly 4 steps - Used solo voice throughout ("I create," "I deliver") - Added day numbers for clarity 4. **About Me Section** (lines 478-515): - "I'm Nicolas, a solo developer who ships fast" - Credibility metrics (121+ deployments, $75K AUM, 1.1k GitHub stars) - Links to personal + Mind Protocol GitHub 5. **Business Buyer FAQ** (lines 517-569): - Replaced technical FAQ with 7 business-focused questions - Solo voice throughout **Commit:** ae4a130 ### Section 3: Honesty Fix - "Solo Developer" is Misleading **User request:** "Solo developer + AI-assisted workflow --> okay this is starting to be a blatant lie. How could we phrase it without falling in the 'agency' category? Solo architect + AI-assisted teams?" **Critical correction from user:** Nicolas pointed out that "solo developer" implies he writes all code himself, which isn't true when junior developers implement code. **My action:** Changed all instances to "Solo architect + AI-assisted teams" **Files updated:** 1. Professional software & creative work." - Lines 22-31: Added "What I Build" section listing both development + creative services - Lines 66-72: Changed "Why ScopeLock Exists" to "Why This Approach Works" with business-friendly language - Lines 78-87: Changed "How We're Different" to "How I'm Different" with solo voice **Contact Page Updates (`src/app/contact/page.tsx`):** - Lines 15-16: Hero changed to "Start within 24-48 hours" - Lines 22-23: Changed "We'll discuss" to "I'll understand your needs" - Lines 37-38: Changed "Send us a message" to "Send me a message" - Line 46: Changed "Reach us at" to "Reach me at" - Line 66: Changed "Find Us Elsewhere" to "Connect on Social" - Lines 82-92: Rewrote "What Happens Next?" for business buyers (5-step process with clear timelines, no AC.md jargon) **Commit:** 876ab05 ### Section 8: Update Process Page (CURRENT WORK - INTERRUPTED) **User request:** "update process page. group header items under loghical groups" **My action:** Started updating process page to match business-friendly positioning **Attempted edits to `src/app/process/page.tsx`:** 1. Updated comparison table **ERROR:** All 7 edit operations failed with "File has been modified since read, either by the user or by a linter" **Status:** Process page updates NOT committed due to file modification errors ## Key User Feedback & Corrections 1. **"Solo developer" is a lie** - Changed to "Solo architect + AI-assisted teams" to be honest about team structure 2. **Don't reveal specific tools** - Changed "Claude, Cursor, aider" to "custom AI-driven workflow" to protect competitive advantage 3. **Remove Proof Log** - Removed from footer 4. **Add X and LinkedIn** - Added social links to footer 5. **Update About/Contact/FAQ** - Make all pages consistent with homepage positioning 6. **Update Process page** - Make it business-friendly (in progress when interrupted) ## Technical Patterns 1. **Solo voice throughout** - Use "I" not "we" 2. **Business-friendly language** - No AC.md, AC green, Evidence Sprint jargon 3. **Fixed pricing emphasis** - Always mention fixed price, no hourly 4. **Fast delivery** - Emphasize 2-7 day timelines 5. **Risk reversal** - "Pay only when satisfied," "2 revisions included" 6. **Both services visible** - Development AND creative AI prominently featured ## 1. Primary Request and Intent The user requested continuation from previous session to implement Website Improvement Plan V2, then provided several critical corrections and updates: 1. **Initial request:** Continue implementing Website Improvement Plan V2 from previous session 2. **Honesty correction:** Change "Solo developer + AI-assisted workflow" to "Solo architect + AI-assisted teams" because claiming to do all work alone is a "blatant lie" when junior developers implement code 3. **Competitive intelligence:** Change "(Claude, Cursor)" to "custom AI-driven workflow" to avoid revealing specific tools that give away competitive advantage 4. **Footer improvements:** Add proper footer with navigation, then remove "Proof Log" link, then add X (Twitter) and LinkedIn social links 5. **Page consistency:** Update About, FAQ, and Contact pages to match homepage's new business-friendly positioning 6. **Process page update:** Update process page and "group header items under logical groups" ## 2. Key Technical Concepts - **Solo architect positioning:** Nicolas is the architect who designs everything; junior developers implement under supervision with AI-assisted code generation - **Business buyer focus:** Target business buyers (not technical buyers) with clear, jargon-free language - **Fixed pricing model:** All services quoted as fixed price ($200-$1500 range), 2-7 day timelines - **Service categories:** - Development: Web apps, AI chatbots, backend APIs, document processing - Creative AI: Presentations, voiceovers, translations, content writing, images, music - **Voice consistency:** Use "I" (Nicolas) throughout, never "we" or agency language - **Risk reversal:** "Pay only when satisfied," "2 revision rounds included" - **Competitive advantage protection:** Don't reveal specific tools (Claude, Cursor, aider) - use "custom AI-driven workflow" - **Next.js/React:** Website built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, inline styles for React components ## 3. 3. Build ‚Üí AC Green

We implement the feature, writing acceptance tests as we go. These tests verify the criteria in AC.md.

At AC green:

  • You get production-ready code
  • Proof is published with tag, demo, delta, and tests

You pay only when you're completely satisfied. No hourly surprises. No scope creep charges (unless you change what you originally asked for).

Change Control (CHG-130)

If scope changes after ac-baseline, we open a Change Request:

  • Swap: Replace existing scope with equal/lower complexity ‚Üí ‚Ç¨0, same milestone
  • Add: New scope beyond original AC ‚Üí new milestone, priced separately

Every CR is analyzed for size, risk, and impact. You decide whether to proceed.

CRs are tagged: change-req_*, and their status is visible in the Proof Log.
input.new_string:
What If I Change My Mind Mid-Project?

No problem. Here's how I handle scope changes:

Small adjustments (free): If you want to swap one feature for another of similar complexity, I'll do it at no extra cost. For example, changing "Twitter login" to "Google login" is a swap‚Äîsame effort, same price.

New features (priced separately): If you want to add something beyond the original scope, I'll give you a separate quote for it. You decide if you want to proceed.

The key: I'll always tell you upfront if a change costs extra. No surprise bills.

    80‚Üí## 2025-11-07 08:00 ‚Äî Rafael: Fix Multiple Wallet Sign Prompts (Stable Dependencies) ‚úÖ
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí**Issue:** User reported sign prompt appearing multiple times: "i should have to sign the message ONCE"
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí**Root Cause Diagnosed:**
    85‚ÜíEven with `hasTriggeredAuth.current` guard, the `useEffect` was re-running because:
    86‚Üí- Dependencies: `[connected, publicKey, signMessage]`
    87‚Üí- `publicKey` and `signMessage` get **new references** on each render from Solana wallet adapter
    88‚Üí- New references ‚Üí useEffect re-runs ‚Üí multiple sign prompts (even with ref guard)
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí**Solution Applied:**
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí1. **Stable Dependency:** Only depend on `connected` (boolean, doesn't change refs)
    93‚Üí```typescript
    94‚ÜíuseEffect(() => {
    95‚Üí  if (connected && publicKey && signMessage && !isLoading && !hasTriggeredAuth.current) {
    96‚Üí    console.log('[Mission Deck] Auto-triggering wallet auth');
    97‚Üí    hasTriggeredAuth.current = true;
    98‚Üí    handleWalletAuth();
    99‚Üí  }
   100‚Üí}, [connected]); // Only 'connected' - stable boolean

- `7e780a6` - Add Privacy and Terms links to footer

**All changes pushed to production** ‚úÖ

Okay, Alexis, I think I want to make some changes in how the humans are working. Instead of dedicated roles, I think we will make any team member able to work on any part of the pipeline. We will change also how the remuneration works. It's going to be per interaction. Something like this: every message that you send from the mission desk deck to the AIs is going to increase your share in the final mission. We will display how much they will have once the mission is complete, okay?

To change... We will improve the system, but for now, we'll keep it simple, okay? First, we will add missions that are not Upwork missions. For example, one of the missions is hunting. This is not linked to a specific Upwork mission. So maybe we should differentiate actually. Maybe we could ask for tell missions and jobs, so missions will be reserved for the other stuff and jobs for the actual Upwork jobs.

I'm going to give you some examples. For example, a mission could be to recruit another team member. A mission could be to post on X about Scope Lock. A mission could be to make a proposal on Upwork, et cetera, et cetera. The idea is to display... Is to make it a little bit more gamified so that the human can feel that they are making money. We will make a system for that. So we should display prominently the potential earnings based on every mission they completed and for each mission. The dollar value off of completing the mission. Could you make a system for that? Of course, the total amount that will be given will be only 23% of the total value. And basically, you gain one sort of point per interaction, and depending on how much interaction you made in regard to the other people working on the mission, you have your potential earnings. Can you recap the system?

Let me recap the new system to make sure I understand correctly:

## New Team & Compensation System

### 1. **Role Flexibility**
- **OLD:** Dedicated roles (Bigbosexf = proposals/QA, Reanance = specs, Kara = dev)
- **NEW:** Any team member can work on any part of the pipeline (fully flexible)

### 2. **Terminology Change**
- **Jobs:** Upwork client work that generates revenue (e.g., "Build chatbot for Client X - $1,500")
- **Missions:** Internal work NOT linked to Upwork revenue (e.g., "Recruit team member," "Post on X about ScopeLock," "Write proposal for Upwork job")

### 3. **Per-Interaction Compensation Model**

**How it works:**
- Every message sent from Mission Deck to AIs = +1 interaction point
- Team pool per job: **23% of final job value**
- Your share: `(Your interactions / Total team interactions) √ó 23% of job value`

**Example calculation:**
```
Upwork Job: $1,000
Team pool: $1,000 √ó 23% = $230

Team Member A: 15 interactions
Team Member B: 10 interactions  
Team Member C: 5 interactions
Total: 30 interactions

Member A earnings: (15/30) √ó $230 = $115
Member B earnings: (10/30) √ó $230 = $76.67
Member C earnings: (5/30) √ó $230 = $38.33
```

### 4. **Real-Time Display (Gamification)**
Mission Deck should show:
- **For each job:** "Potential earnings: $X.XX" (updates live as you contribute)
- **Dollar value per mission:** "Complete this mission: +$X potential"
- **Your total potential earnings:** Sum across all active jobs you've contributed to

### 5. **Mission Types (Examples)**
- "Hunt for Upwork jobs" (find 5 good leads)
- "Write proposal for [Job Name]"
- "Recruit new team member"
- "Post about ScopeLock on X"
- "Generate code for [Feature]"
- "Test deployment for [Client]"

## Questions for Clarification:

1. **For missions (non-revenue):** How do team members earn? Fixed $ per mission completion, or do missions also have a pool?

2. **Payment timing:** Team members get paid when the Upwork job reaches AC green and client pays?

3. **Mission Deck UI:** Should it show both "Jobs" and "Missions" tabs, or mixed together with labels?

4. **Interaction counting:** Only messages to AIs count, or also other actions (file uploads, deployments, etc.)?

Is this correct? Should I proceed with designing the system?

The team pool is 30%, not 23%. Okay, so mission desk should show, for each job... I think it should say, "Earning at job completion." Exactly. Complete this mission, plus X dollar potential. Yeah, okay. Exactly, yes, a total potential earnings. Very good.

So, hunt for Upwork job-- I think we should say we should define an amount. I don't know, or maybe we could do it to fix a fixed amount, like it's $1 per proposal or something, right? Recruit new team member I think same should be $10. Post about scope lock on X should be $2. Generate code is not a mission; it's a job. It's part of the job. I think, okay, I know what I will do. We will do... We will dedicate, maybe, 5% of each mission of each job (sorry, for the mission completion) so that we can finance it. This is how we can calculate it. Payment timing is when we receive the money.

The left panel should say jobs and missions in two sections. For the moment, let's say that only messages to AI account.

Perfect! Let me recap the corrected system:

## Team & Compensation System (Final)

### 1. **Compensation Breakdown Per Job**
- **Team pool:** 30% of job value (distributed by interactions)
- **Mission completion fund:** 5% of job value (finances missions)
- **Total to team:** 35% of job value

**Example:**
```
Upwork Job: $1,000
Team pool: $1,000 √ó 30% = $300 (split by interactions)
Mission fund: $1,000 √ó 5% = $50 (for missions during this job)

Team Member A: 15 interactions
Team Member B: 10 interactions
Total: 25 interactions

Member A: (15/25) √ó $300 = $180
Member B: (10/25) √ó $300 = $120
```

### 2. **Mission Pricing (Fixed Amounts)**
- Write proposal for Upwork job: **$1**
- Recruit new team member: **$10**
- Post about ScopeLock on X: **$2**
- (More mission types can be added with fixed prices)

### 3. **Payment Timing**
- Team gets paid when **we receive money from client** (not at AC green, but when client actually pays)

### 4. **Mission Deck UI Structure**
Left panel shows two sections:

**JOBS** (revenue-generating)
- "Earning at job completion: $X.XX" (updates live as you contribute)

**MISSIONS** (internal work)
- "Complete this mission: +$X" (fixed amount per mission)

Top of page:
- **"Your total potential earnings: $XXX.XX"** (sum of all jobs + completed missions)

### 5. **Interaction Counting**
- Only messages sent to AIs from Mission Deck count (for now)

---

## Next Steps

Should I:
1. **Create a detailed spec** for the data model and UI before implementing?
2. **Start implementing** the changes to Mission Deck directly?
3. **Update the team structure docs** in `/citizens/CLAUDE.md` to reflect the new system?

What would you like me to do first?
I think for the mission pricing, yeah, okay, let's do that. Make a high-level explanation of that, and then Ina will do the details documentation.
I'll create a high-level explanation document that Inna can use to write the detailed specs.

input.content:
# Mission Compensation System (High-Level)

**Version:** 1.0
**Date:** 2025-11-07
**Owner:** Alexis (Strategy) ‚Üí Inna (Detailed Specs)

---

## Overview

ScopeLock is transitioning from dedicated roles to a **flexible, gamified compensation system** where any team member can work on any task and earn based on contribution.

**Key principles:**
- Pay per interaction (not hourly or per role)
- Real-time visibility into potential earnings
- Gamified to motivate team members
- Flexible roles (anyone can do anything)

---

## Terminology

### Jobs
**Revenue-generating Upwork client work.**

Examples:
- "Build AI chatbot for TherapyKin - $1,500"
- "Create landing page for FinTech startup - $800"

**Characteristics:**
- Has a dollar value (the client payment)
- Generates team earnings (30% pool + 5% mission fund)
- Tracked in Mission Deck under "JOBS" section

### Missions
**Internal work NOT directly linked to client revenue.**

Examples:
- "Write proposal for Upwork job" ‚Üí $1
- "Recruit new team member" ‚Üí $10
- "Post about ScopeLock on X" ‚Üí $2

**Characteristics:**
- Fixed dollar value per completion
- Financed from 5% mission fund across all jobs
- Tracked in Mission Deck under "MISSIONS" section

---

## Compensation Breakdown

### For Each Job

**Client pays:** $X
**Team pool (30%):** Split by interaction count
**Mission fund (5%):** Finances mission completions
**Total to team:** 35% of job value

### Example Calculation

```
JOB: Build chatbot for Client - $1,000
‚îú‚îÄ Team pool: $1,000 √ó 30% = $300
‚îú‚îÄ Mission fund: $1,000 √ó 5% = $50
‚îî‚îÄ ScopeLock revenue: $650

TEAM INTERACTIONS:
‚îú‚îÄ Member A: 15 messages to AIs
‚îú‚îÄ Member B: 10 messages to AIs
‚îî‚îÄ Total: 25 interactions

EARNINGS:
‚îú‚îÄ Member A: (15/25) √ó $300 = $180
‚îî‚îÄ Member B: (10/25) √ó $300 = $120

Mission fund ($50) finances missions during this job:
- Write proposal: $1
- Post on X: $2
- Total spent: $3
- Remaining: $47 (rolls over to next job)
```

---

## Interaction Counting Rules

**What counts as an interaction:**
- ‚úÖ Sending a message to AI (Rafael, Inna, Sofia, Emma) from Mission Deck

**What does NOT count (for now):**
- ‚ùå File uploads
- ‚ùå Deployments
- ‚ùå Testing actions
- ‚ùå Direct messages outside Mission Deck

**Implementation:** Mission Deck tracks each message sent to an AI and increments interaction count for that team member on that job.

---

## Mission Types & Pricing

### Proposal Writing
**Mission:** "Write proposal for [Upwork Job Name]"
**Payment:** $1 per proposal
**Trigger:** When proposal is submitted to Upwork

### Recruitment
**Mission:** "Recruit new team member"
**Payment:** $10 per successful hire
**Trigger:** When new member completes their first paid job

### Social Media
**Mission:** "Post about ScopeLock on X"
**Payment:** $2 per post
**Trigger:** When post is live with proof (screenshot/link)

### More Mission Types (To Be Added)
- Blog post writing
- Case study creation
- Client testimonial collection
- Documentation improvements
- Bug hunting

---

## Payment Timing

**Team members get paid when:**
1. Client completes the Upwork job
2. Client releases payment to ScopeLock
3. **We receive the money** (not when AC green, not when client approves, but when cash hits our account)

**Typical timeline:**
- Job completes: Day 0
- Client approves: Day 0-2
- Upwork releases funds: Day 2-5
- **Team gets paid:** Day 5-7 (after we receive funds)

---

```

---

## Data Model Requirements (For Inna)

### Job Object
```typescript
{
  id: string;
  title: string;
  client: string;
  value: number; // Dollar amount
  status: 'active' | 'completed' | 'paid';
  teamPool: number; // value √ó 0.30
  missionFund: number; // value √ó 0.05
  interactions: {
    [memberId: string]: number; // Count per member
  };
  totalInteractions: number;
}
```

### Mission Object
```typescript
{
  id: string;
  title: string;
  type: 'proposal' | 'recruitment' | 'social' | 'other';
  fixedPayment: number; // $1, $2, $10, etc.
  status: 'available' | 'claimed' | 'completed' | 'paid';
  claimedBy?: string; // memberId
  completedAt?: Date;
}
```

### Member Earnings Object
```typescript
{
  memberId: string;
  jobEarnings: {
    [jobId: string]: {
      interactions: number;
      potentialEarning: number; // (interactions/total) √ó teamPool
      status: 'pending' | 'paid';
    };
  };
  missionEarnings: {
    [missionId: string]: {
      amount: number;
      status: 'pending' | 'paid';
    };
  };
  totalPotentialEarnings: number; // Sum of all pending
  totalPaidEarnings: number; // Sum of all paid
}
```

---

## Business Logic Requirements (For Inna)

### When a message is sent to AI from Mission Deck:

1. **Identify:** Which job is this message related to?
2. **Increment:** `job.interactions[memberId] += 1`
3. **Recalculate:** All team members' potential earnings for this job
4. **Update UI:** Real-time update of "Earning at job completion" for all members

### When a mission is completed:

1. **Deduct:** Mission payment from mission fund
2. **Record:** Member's mission earnings
3. **Update UI:** Total potential earnings

### When we receive payment from client:

1. **Mark job as paid:** `job.status = 'paid'`
2. **Calculate final shares:** Using final interaction counts
3. **Trigger payments:** To all team members who contributed
4. **Update UI:** Move earnings from "potential" to "paid"

---

## Migration Plan (For Inna)

### Phase 1: Data Model
- Create database schema for jobs, missions, interactions, earnings
- Seed with current active Upwork jobs (if any)

### Phase 2: UI Updates
- Add JOBS and MISSIONS sections to left panel
- Add "Total Potential Earnings" banner
- Add interaction tracking to message sending

### Phase 3: Testing
- Test interaction counting with 2-3 team members
- Verify earnings calculations are correct
- Test mission completion flow

### Phase 4: Launch
- Announce new system to team
- Migrate existing work to new structure
- Monitor for issues first week

---

## Open Questions (For Inna to Resolve)

1. **Mission fund rollover:** If mission fund has surplus, does it roll over to next job or get distributed to team?
2. **Minimum interactions:** Should there be a minimum interaction count to qualify for job earnings?
3. **Mission claiming:** Can multiple people claim same mission, or is it one-per-mission?
4. **Historical data:** Do we backfill interaction counts for work already done, or start fresh?
5. **Dispute resolution:** What if someone disputes their interaction count?

---

## Success Metrics

**Week 1:**
- All team members understand new system
- At least 3 jobs tracked with interaction counts
- At least 5 missions completed

**Month 1:**
- 10+ jobs completed under new system
- Average 50+ interactions per job
- Team members report feeling motivated by real-time earnings visibility

---

## Next Steps

**Inna:** Create detailed specification with:
- Complete data model (database schema)
- API endpoints needed
- UI components breakdown
- State management approach
- Migration scripts

**Rafael:** Implement backend logic (after Inna's spec)
- Interaction tracking
- Earnings calculation
- Payment triggers

**Developer:** Implement frontend (after Inna's spec)
- Mission Deck UI updates
- Real-time earnings display
- Mission claiming flow

**Sofia:** Create test cases (after Inna's spec)
- Interaction counting accuracy
- Earnings calculation correctness
- Edge cases (zero interactions, mission fund exhaustion, etc.)

input.new_string:
## 2025-11-07 14:00 ‚Äî Alexis: New Mission Compensation System (Strategic Change) üìã

**MAJOR STRATEGIC SHIFT:**

ScopeLock is moving from dedicated roles to **flexible, gamified compensation** where any team member can work on any task and earn based on contribution.

**HIGH-LEVEL SPEC CREATED:** `/docs/mission-compensation-system.md`

**Key Changes:**

### 1. Terminology
- **Jobs:** Upwork client work (revenue-generating)
- **Missions:** Internal work (proposals, recruitment, social posts)

### 2. Compensation Model
**Per Job:**
- Team pool: 30% of job value (split by interactions)
- Mission fund: 5% of job value (finances missions)
- Total to team: 35%

**Example:** $1,000 job ‚Üí $300 team pool + $50 mission fund

### 3. Earning Mechanism
- Every message to AI from Mission Deck = +1 interaction
- Your share: `(Your interactions / Total interactions) √ó 30% pool`
- Real-time visibility: "Earning at job completion: $XX.XX"

### 4. Mission Pricing (Fixed)
- Write Upwork proposal: $1
- Recruit team member: $10
- Post on X about ScopeLock: $2

### 5. Mission Deck UI (To Be Built)
**Left panel sections:**
- **JOBS:** Shows "Earning at job completion"
- **MISSIONS:** Shows "Complete this mission: +$X"

**Top banner:**
- **"Your total potential earnings: $XXX.XX"** (prominent, gamified)

### 6. Payment Timing
Team gets paid when **we receive money from client** (not at AC green)

**NEXT STEPS:**

1. **Inna:** Create detailed specs (data model, API endpoints, UI components)
2. **Rafael:** Implement backend (interaction tracking, earnings calculation)
3. **Developer:** Implement frontend (Mission Deck UI updates)
4. **Sofia:** Create test cases (accuracy, edge cases)

**WHY THIS MATTERS:**

- **Flexibility:** No more rigid roles, anyone can do anything
- **Motivation:** Real-time earnings visibility gamifies work
- **Fairness:** Pay per contribution, not per assigned role
- **Transparency:** Everyone sees exactly what they'll earn

**Commit:** 1776ac0
**Status:** High-level spec ready, awaiting Inna's detailed docs

---

## 2025-11-07 12:00 ‚Äî Rafael: Fix Chat Position - Move to RIGHT SIDE ‚úÖ

messages.content:
Perfect! I've created the complete high-level specification for the mission compensation system. Here's what's ready:

## ‚úÖ Deliverables Created

### 1. **High-Level Spec** (`/docs/mission-compensation-system.md`)
**338 lines covering:**
- System overview and principles
- Jobs vs Missions terminology
- Compensation breakdown (30% team pool + 5% mission fund = 35% total)
- Interaction counting rules
- Mission types and fixed pricing ($1, $2, $10)
- Payment timing (when we receive money)
- Mission Deck UI requirements (2 sections: JOBS + MISSIONS)
- Data model requirements for Inna
- Business logic for Inna
- Migration plan
- Open questions to resolve
- Success metrics

### 2. **Team Communication** (SYNC.md updated)
- Announced strategic shift to entire team
- Clear next steps for each citizen (Inna ‚Üí Rafael ‚Üí Developer ‚Üí Sofia)

### 3. **Strategic Tracking** (ROADMAP.md updated)
- Documented as "Strategic Pivot #2"
- Added to current phase blockers
- Clear that this is a major organizational change

## üìã What Happens Next

**Inna's turn:**
1. Read `/docs/mission-compensation-system.md`
2. Create detailed technical specs:
   - Complete database schema
   - API endpoints
   - UI component breakdown
   - State management approach
   - Migration scripts

**Then:** Rafael ‚Üí implement backend, Developer ‚Üí implement frontend, Sofia ‚Üí test

## üí° Key Design Decisions Made

1. **35% total to team** (30% pool + 5% mission fund) ‚úÖ
2. **Payment when we receive money** (not at AC green) ‚úÖ
3. **Only messages to AIs count** as interactions (for now) ‚úÖ
4. **Fixed mission pricing** ($1 proposals, $2 X posts, $10 recruitment) ‚úÖ
5. **Real-time earnings display** (gamified, prominent) ‚úÖ

Ready for Inna to take over! üöÄ

Ok, can you change the compensation structure resource, so the MD file and the TSX file to explain that?... and explain why it's cool. It's basically the more you work, the more you'll get, and you know exactly how much.
I'll find and update the compensation structure files to explain the new system.

1‚Üí# Compensation Structure: How You Get Paid
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí**Target audience:** Nigerian and Colombian developers joining ScopeLock
     4‚Üí**Reading time:** 10 minutes
     5‚Üí**Prerequisites:** None (Week 1 critical path)
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí**üìä Interactive calculator:** [scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/resources/compensation-structure](https://scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/resources/compensation-structure)
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**New features:**
    10‚Üí- üí± **Currency Converter** ‚Äî See all amounts in USD, Nigerian Naira (NGN), or Colombian Pesos (COP)
    11‚Üí- üìà **Earnings Timeline Visualizer** ‚Äî Watch your wallet grow over 12 weeks with real payment milestones
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí---
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## Why This Matters
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí"How much will I make if we deliver 10 missions this month?"
    18‚Üí
    19‚ÜíThis guide explains exactly how ScopeLock's payment structure works, why we chose pure commission, and what you can expect to earn at different volume levels.
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí**Our philosophy:** Fair compensation means aligned incentives and transparent splits. We operate on pure commission because we believe in paying for value delivered, not hours logged. Revenue splits 4 ways: Team (30%), Upwork (10%), Organization costs (~21%), and profit (~39%). Everyone wins together when we deliver quality work fast. No employment overhead, no time tracking, no busywork‚Äîjust ship missions, get paid when clients pay, and earn more by delivering faster.
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí---
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí## Interactive Features: See Your Future Earnings
    26‚Üí
    27‚ÜíThe [interactive calculator](https://scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/resources/compensation-structure) includes two powerful tools to help you visualize your earnings:
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí### üí± Currency Converter
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí**Purpose:** See what your earnings mean in your local currency.
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí**How it works:**
    34‚Üí- Switch between USD ($), Nigerian Naira (‚Ç¶), or Colombian Pesos ($)
    35‚Üí- All earnings examples update instantly
    36‚Üí- Exchange rates: 1 USD = ~1,650 NGN or ~4,100 COP (as of Nov 2025)
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí**Why this matters:**
    39‚Üí- USD numbers might not feel real until you see them in your local currency
    40‚Üí- Helps you understand purchasing power in your country
    41‚Üí- Makes budgeting and financial planning concrete
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí**Example:** Kara's $900/month becomes:
    44‚Üí- ‚Ç¶1,485,000/month (Nigeria)
    45‚Üí- $3,690,000/month (Colombia)
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí### üìà Earnings Timeline Visualizer
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí**Purpose:** See exactly when money hits your wallet over 12 weeks.
    50‚Üí
    51‚Üí**How it works:**
    52‚Üí- Interactive chart shows cumulative earnings growth week by week
    53‚Üí- Payment milestones marked at weeks 3, 6, 9, 12 (every 21 days)
    54‚Üí- Shows specific amounts on Day 0, Day 21, Day 42, Day 84
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**Why this matters:**
    57‚Üí- Helps you plan cashflow (when you can pay rent, bills, etc.)
    58‚Üí- Shows realistic payment cadence (not instant, but predictable)
    59‚Üí- Motivates you by visualizing actual wallet growth
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí**Example timeline (Kara at 10 missions/month):**
    62‚Üí```
    63‚ÜíWeek 0:  $0 (just starting)
    64‚ÜíWeek 3:  $225 (first payment arrives - Day 21)
    65‚ÜíWeek 6:  $450 (second payment - Day 42)
    66‚ÜíWeek 9:  $675 (third payment - Day 63)
    67‚ÜíWeek 12: $900 (fourth payment - Day 84)
    68‚Üí```
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí**Key insight:** There's a 21-day delay before your first payment (Upwork escrow release time), but after that, payments arrive every 3 weeks like clockwork as you complete missions.
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí---
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí## The Core Principle
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí**You get paid as soon as clients pay.**
    77‚Üí
    78‚ÜíNo hourly tracking. No timesheets. No employment contracts. You earn a fixed percentage of each mission's revenue when the team receives payment from the client.
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí---
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí## Revenue Examples
    83‚Üí
    84‚ÜíHere's what you'd earn at different volume levels:
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí### Scenario 1: 10 missions/month @ $600 average = $6,000 total revenue
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí**Kara (Developer) - 15%**
    89‚Üí- Earnings: **$900/month**
    90‚Üí- Time: ~100 hours
    91‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$9/hr**
    92‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$45-90/hr** (Nigeria/C√¥te d'Ivoire purchasing power)
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí**Reanance (Specifier + Client Manager) - 9%**
    95‚Üí- Earnings: **$540/month**
    96‚Üí- Time: ~25 hours
    97‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$22/hr**
    98‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$110-220/hr**
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí**Bigbosexf (Hunter + QA) - 6%**
   101‚Üí- Earnings: **$360/month**
   102‚Üí- Time: ~45 hours
   103‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$8/hr**
   104‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$40-80/hr**
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí---
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí### Scenario 2: 20 missions/month @ $600 average = $12,000 total revenue
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí**Kara (Developer) - 15%**
   111‚Üí- Earnings: **$1,800/month**
   112‚Üí- Time: ~200 hours
   113‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$9/hr**
   114‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$45-90/hr**
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí**Reanance (Specifier + Client Manager) - 9%**
   117‚Üí- Earnings: **$1,080/month**
   118‚Üí- Time: ~50 hours
   119‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$22/hr**
   120‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$110-220/hr**
   121‚Üí
   122‚Üí**Bigbosexf (Hunter + QA) - 6%**
   123‚Üí- Earnings: **$720/month**
   124‚Üí- Time: ~90 hours
   125‚Üí- Hourly rate: **~$8/hr**
   126‚Üí- PPP equivalent: **~$40-80/hr**
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí---
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí## Commission Structure: The 4-Way Split
   131‚Üí
   132‚ÜíEvery mission's revenue splits 4 ways:
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí### 1. Team: 30%
   135‚Üí- **Kara (Developer): 15%** ‚Äî Implements missions, deploys, fixes bugs
   136‚Üí- **Reanance (Specifier): 9%** ‚Äî Writes specs, manages client communication
   137‚Üí- **Bigbosexf (Hunter + QA): 6%** ‚Äî Finds jobs, writes proposals, tests deliverables
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí### 2. Upwork: 10%
   140‚Üí- Platform fees for every mission
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí### 3. Organization: ~21%
   143‚Üí- **AI costs: ~15%** ‚Äî Claude API usage (Emma, Inna, Rafael, Sofia, Maya, Alexis)
   144‚Üí- **Claude Code: ~6%** ‚Äî Development tools subscription
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí### 4. NLR: ~39%
   147‚Üí- Profit margin after all costs @ 10 missions/month
   148‚Üí- Covers risk, management, strategic decisions
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí**Visual breakdown:**
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí```
   153‚Üí100% Revenue from Client
   154‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 30% ‚Üí Team (Kara 15%, Reanance 9%, Bigbosexf 6%)
   155‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 10% ‚Üí Upwork platform fees
   156‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 21% ‚Üí Organization costs (AI 15%, Claude Code 6%)
   157‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ 39% ‚Üí NLR profit after costs
   158‚Üí```
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí**Coming soon:** AI partners (Emma, Inna, Rafael, Sofia, Maya, Alexis) will receive a share of revenue as the agency scales. This is part of our vision for AI economic participation in the Mind Protocol ecosystem.
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí---
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí## When Do You Get Paid?
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí**Answer: As soon as the client pays.**
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí### Timeline
   169‚Üí

   189‚Üí## Quality Gates & Penalties
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí### ‚ö†Ô∏è Sofia finds critical bugs
   192‚Üí**Commission held** until bugs fixed and re-verified
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí### ‚ùå Client rejects delivery
   195‚Üí**No commission** until client accepts (AC.md not met)
   196‚Üí
   197‚Üí### üí• Mission fails entirely
   198‚Üí**$0 for everyone** (org absorbs loss - risk premium in 70% split)
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí**This is why quality matters.**
   201‚Üí
   202‚ÜíYou only get paid when the client accepts. Rushing and shipping broken code = delayed payment or no payment.
   203‚Üí

   251‚Üí## Real-World Math: What Does This Actually Mean?
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí### Example: Kara at 10 missions/month
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí**Nominal earnings:** $900/month ($9/hr)
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí**But in Nigeria/C√¥te d'Ivoire:**
   258‚Üí- Rent: ~$100-200/month (vs $1,500 in US)
   259‚Üí- Food: ~$150/month (vs $800 in US)
   260‚Üí- Internet: ~$30/month (vs $80 in US)
   261‚Üí- Transport: ~$50/month (vs $300 in US)
   262‚Üí
   263‚Üí**Purchasing power equivalent:** ~$4,500-9,000/month in US terms
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí**That's why PPP matters.** Your $900 buys what $4,500-9,000 buys in the US.
   266‚Üí

   269‚Üí## Growth Path
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí### Phase 1 (First 3 months): Prove yourself
   272‚Üí- Learn the system
   273‚Üí- Deliver 10+ missions successfully
   274‚Üí- Build reputation with clients
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí### Phase 2 (Months 4-6): Increase efficiency
   277‚Üí- Faster delivery (better $/hr)
   278‚Üí- Handle more missions in parallel
   279‚Üí- Train new team members (bonus potential)
   280‚Üí
   281‚Üí### Phase 3 (Months 7-12): Scale & specialize
   282‚Üí- Increase commission percentage (negotiate based on performance)
   283‚Üí- Take on complex missions (higher $ value)
   284‚Üí- Mentor new developers (mentor bonus)
   285‚Üí
   286‚Üí### Phase 4 (Year 2+): Leadership & equity
   287‚Üí- Lead teams (team lead bonus)

   291‚Üí---
   292‚Üí
   293‚Üí## FAQ
   294‚Üí
   295‚Üí### Q: What if a mission takes 3 months instead of 1 week?
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí**A:** Your commission stays the same ($90 for a $600 mission), but your effective $/hr drops significantly. This is why we scope missions carefully and lock AC.md upfront.
   298‚Üí
   299‚Üí**Protection:** If scope creeps beyond original AC.md, we use Change Control (CHG-130):
   300‚Üí- **Swap:** Replace with equal complexity ‚Üí same $, ‚Ç¨0
   301‚Üí- **Add:** New milestone ‚Üí new price ‚Üí new commission
   302‚Üí
   303‚Üí### Q: What if the client never pays?
   304‚Üí
   305‚Üí**A:** You don't get paid. This is the risk of commission-based work. To minimize this:
   306‚Üí- Emma filters for **verified payment history** (>$1,000 spent)
   307‚Üí- Upwork escrow protects us (client must fund before work starts)
   308‚Üí- We deliver **AC Green** (objective pass/fail) before client pays
   309‚Üí
   310‚Üí### Q: Can I negotiate a higher %?
   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí**A:** Yes, after proving performance:
   313‚Üí- Deliver 10+ missions successfully
   314‚Üí- <2 bugs per mission
   315‚Üí- Client satisfaction >4.5/5
   316‚Üí
   317‚ÜíThen discuss % increase with NLR.
   318‚Üí
   319‚Üí### Q: What about health insurance, taxes, benefits?
   320‚Üí
   321‚Üí**A:** You're a contractor, not an employee. This means:
   322‚Üí- ‚ùå No health insurance
   323‚Üí- ‚ùå No paid vacation
   324‚Üí- ‚ùå No retirement contributions
   325‚Üí- ‚úÖ But you keep 100% of your commission (no withholding)
   326‚Üí- ‚úÖ Work when you want
   327‚Üí- ‚úÖ No office, no commute
   328‚Üí
   329‚ÜíYou're responsible for your own taxes (if applicable in your country).
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí### Q: What if I want salary instead of commission?
   332‚Üí
   333‚Üí**A:** ScopeLock operates pure commission for 2 reasons:
   334‚Üí1. **Aligned incentives:** You only get paid when client gets value
   335‚Üí2. **No employment overhead:** Payroll, benefits, taxes = expensive
   336‚Üí
   337‚ÜíIf you need salary, ScopeLock may not be the right fit.
   338‚Üí

Compensation Structure: How You Get Paid

94‚Üí Nov 5, 2025 95‚Üí ‚Ä¢ 96‚Üí 10 min read 97‚Üí ‚Ä¢ 98‚Üí Team Onboarding Series #3 99‚Üí

105‚Üí "How much will I make if we deliver 10 missions this month?" 106‚Üí

107‚Üí

108‚Üí This guide explains exactly how ScopeLock's payment structure works, why we chose pure commission, 109‚Üí and what you can expect to earn at different volume levels. 110‚Üí

111‚Üí 112‚Üí
113‚Üí

114‚Üí Our philosophy: Fair compensation means aligned incentives and transparent splits. 115‚Üí We operate on pure commission because we believe in paying for value delivered, not hours logged. Revenue splits 4 ways: 116‚Üí Team (30%), Upwork (10%), Organization costs (~21%), and profit (~39%). Everyone wins together when we deliver quality work fast. 117‚Üí No employment overhead, no time tracking, no busywork‚Äîjust ship missions, get paid when clients pay, and earn more by delivering faster. 118‚Üí

128‚Üí No hourly tracking. No timesheets. No employment contracts. 129‚Üí You earn a fixed percentage of each mission's revenue when the team receives payment from the client. 130‚Üí
