messages.content: Now I'll update both files to explain the new per-interaction compensation system. This will be a major rewrite to explain why it's cool.

input.content:
# Compensation Structure: The More You Work, The More You Earn

**Target audience:** Team members joining ScopeLock
**Reading time:** 12 minutes
**Prerequisites:** None (Week 1 critical path)

**üìä Interactive calculator:** [scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/resources/compensation-structure](https://scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/resources/compensation-structure)

---

## Why This Is Cool

**The more you work, the more you earn. And you know exactly how much.**

Most agencies pay fixed salaries or hourly rates. You work hard on a project, but your teammate slacks off‚Äîyou both get paid the same. That's not fair.

**ScopeLock is different:**
- Every time you send a message to an AI (Rafael, Inna, Sofia, Emma) from Mission Deck, you earn +1 interaction point
- Your share of the job: `(Your interactions / Total team interactions) √ó 30% of job value`
- **Real-time visibility:** You see your potential earnings update live as you work
- **100% fair:** More contribution = more money. Less contribution = less money.

**Example:**
```
Upwork Job: $1,000
Team pool: $300 (30%)

You: 20 interactions
Teammate: 10 interactions
Total: 30 interactions

Your earnings: (20/30) √ó $300 = $200
Teammate earnings: (10/30) √ó $300 = $100

You worked 2x as hard ‚Üí you earn 2x as much. Fair.
```

---

## Why This Matters

**"How much will I make if I contribute to 10 missions this month?"**

It depends on how much you contribute. If you're very active (lots of messages to AIs), you'll earn more than someone who contributes less. This guide explains exactly how the new system works.

**Our philosophy:** Fair compensation means rewarding actual contribution, not arbitrary roles. Work more ‚Üí earn more. Work less ‚Üí earn less. Everyone sees everyone's contribution in real-time. No surprises, no politics, no favoritism.

---

## The New System: Per-Interaction Compensation

### How It Works

**Step 1:** Every message you send to an AI from Mission Deck earns you +1 interaction point for that job.

**Step 2:** When the job completes and the client pays, the 30% team pool is split based on interaction counts:

```
Your share = (Your interactions / Total team interactions) √ó 30% of job value
```

**Step 3:** You get paid when we receive money from the client (typically 21 days after delivery).

### What Counts as an Interaction

‚úÖ **Counts:**
- Sending a message to Rafael (code generation requests)
- Sending a message to Inna (specification questions)
- Sending a message to Sofia (QA requests)
- Sending a message to Emma (proposal assistance)

‚ùå **Does NOT count (for now):**
- File uploads
- Deployments
- Testing actions
- Messages outside Mission Deck

---

## Real Examples

### Example 1: Equal Contribution

**Job:** Build chatbot for Client ($1,000)
**Team pool:** $300 (30%)

**Interactions:**
- You: 15 messages to AIs
- Teammate A: 15 messages to AIs
- Teammate B: 15 messages to AIs
- Total: 45 interactions

**Earnings:**
- You: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**
- Teammate A: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**
- Teammate B: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**

Everyone contributed equally ‚Üí everyone earns equally.

---

### Example 2: You Work Harder

**Job:** Build chatbot for Client ($1,000)
**Team pool:** $300 (30%)

**Interactions:**
- You: 30 messages to AIs (you drove the project)
- Teammate A: 10 messages to AIs
- Teammate B: 5 messages to AIs
- Total: 45 interactions

**Earnings:**
- You: (30/45) √ó $300 = **$200**
- Teammate A: (10/45) √ó $300 = **$67**
- Teammate B: (5/45) √ó $300 = **$33**

You worked 3x harder than Teammate A ‚Üí you earn 3x as much. **Fair.**

---

### Example 3: Multiple Jobs Per Month

**Month:** 10 jobs @ $1,000 average = $10,000 total revenue
**Total team pool:** $3,000 (30% √ó $10,000)

**Your total interactions across all 10 jobs:** 200
**Total team interactions across all 10 jobs:** 400

**Your monthly earnings:** (200/400) √ó $3,000 = **$1,500**

You contributed 50% of the team's work ‚Üí you earn 50% of the team pool.

---

## Missions: Fixed-Price Internal Work

Not all work is tied to Upwork jobs. Some work is internal (proposals, recruitment, social posts). These are called **Missions** and have fixed prices:

### Mission Pricing

- **Write Upwork proposal:** $1 per proposal
- **Recruit new team member:** $10 per successful hire
- **Post about ScopeLock on X:** $2 per post

**How missions are funded:** 5% of every job's value goes into a "mission fund" that pays for these internal tasks.

**Example:**
```
Job: $1,000
Mission fund: $50 (5%)

This $50 pays for:
- 5 proposals written ($5)
- 1 recruitment ($10)
- 10 X posts ($20)
Total spent: $35
Remaining: $15 (rolls over to next job)
```

---

## Total Compensation Breakdown Per Job

**When a $1,000 Upwork job completes:**

```
100% Client Payment: $1,000
‚îú‚îÄ 30% ‚Üí Team Pool ($300) ‚Äî split by interactions
‚îú‚îÄ 5% ‚Üí Mission Fund ($50) ‚Äî pays for missions
‚îú‚îÄ 10% ‚Üí Upwork fees ($100)
‚îú‚îÄ ~21% ‚Üí AI costs ($210) ‚Äî Claude API, tools
‚îî‚îÄ ~34% ‚Üí ScopeLock profit ($340)
```

**You earn from:**
1. **Team pool:** Your share of the 30% based on interactions
2. **Missions completed:** Fixed $ per mission (funded from 5% mission fund)

---

## Mission Deck: Real-Time Earnings Display

The Mission Deck shows you exactly what you'll earn, updated in real-time:

### Left Panel: JOBS Section

```
‚îå‚îÄ JOBS ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ [JOB CARD]                              ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Build AI Chatbot - TherapyKin          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Client: TherapyKin                      ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Value: $1,500                           ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Team pool: $450 (30%)                   ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Your interactions: 12                   ‚îÇ ‚Üê Updates live
‚îÇ Team total: 45                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Earning at job completion: $120.00      ‚îÇ ‚Üê (12/45) √ó $450
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

### Left Panel: MISSIONS Section

```
‚îå‚îÄ MISSIONS ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ [MISSION CARD]                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Write proposal for "AI Dashboard"       ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Complete this mission: +$1.00           ‚îÇ ‚Üê Fixed amount
‚îÇ Status: Available                       ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ [CLAIM MISSION]                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

### Top Banner: Total Potential Earnings

```
‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
‚ïë  YOUR TOTAL POTENTIAL EARNINGS: $342.50          ‚ïë
‚ïë  (From 3 active jobs + 5 completed missions)     ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
```

**This updates every time you send a message to an AI.** You always know exactly where you stand.

---

## When Do You Get Paid?

**Answer: When we receive payment from the client.**

### Timeline

```
Day 0:  Job starts
   ‚Üì
Day 7:  AC Green delivered to client
   ‚Üì
Day 21: Upwork releases funds to ScopeLock
   ‚Üì
Day 21: You get paid (SOL) ‚Äî within 4 hours
```

### Payment Method: Solana (SOL)

- ‚úÖ Instant transfers
- ‚úÖ Near-zero fees (~$0.01)
- ‚úÖ Fully transparent on blockchain
- ‚úÖ You can hold SOL, convert to USDC, or cash out to local currency via Binance

---

## Why This System Is Better

### Old System (Fixed Roles)
‚ùå Kara always gets 15%, even if he barely contributes
‚ùå Reanance always gets 9%, even if she works overtime
‚ùå Bigbosexf always gets 6%, even if he finds 20 jobs this month
‚ùå No incentive to contribute more
‚ùå Resentment builds when effort isn't rewarded

### New System (Per-Interaction)
‚úÖ Work 2x as hard ‚Üí earn 2x as much
‚úÖ Real-time visibility into earnings
‚úÖ 100% transparent (everyone sees everyone's contribution)
‚úÖ Natural incentive to contribute more
‚úÖ Fair distribution based on actual work

---

## Quality Gates & Penalties

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Sofia finds critical bugs
**Commission held** until bugs fixed and re-verified

### ‚ùå Client rejects delivery
**No commission** until client accepts (AC.md not met)

### üí• Job fails entirely
**$0 for everyone** (ScopeLock absorbs loss)

**This is why quality matters.** You only get paid when the client accepts. Rushing and shipping broken code = delayed payment or no payment.

---

## Real-World Math: What Does This Actually Mean?

### Example: You contribute to 10 jobs in a month

**Assumptions:**
- Average job value: $800
- Your interactions: 50% of team total (you're very active)

**Calculation:**
```
Total revenue: 10 √ó $800 = $8,000
Team pool: $8,000 √ó 30% = $2,400

Your share (50% of interactions):
$2,400 √ó 50% = $1,200/month
```

**Plus missions:**
- 10 proposals written: $10
- 5 X posts: $10
- Total missions: $20

**Your total monthly earnings: $1,220**

**In local currency (Nigeria):**
- $1,220 √ó 1,650 NGN/USD = ‚Ç¶2,013,000/month
- That's ~2x median software developer salary in Lagos

**Purchasing power equivalent:** ~$6,000-12,000/month in US terms

---

## Transparency & Tracking

After each job completes, Mission Deck shows payment breakdown:

### Example: Job #47 Payment Breakdown

```
üìä Job #47 Payment Breakdown

Job:                 Build OpenAI chatbot
Client paid:         $600
Date:                2025-11-05
Team pool:           $180 (30%)

INTERACTIONS:
‚úÖ You:              15 interactions (37.5%) ‚Üí $67.50
‚úÖ Teammate A:       12 interactions (30.0%) ‚Üí $54.00
‚úÖ Teammate B:       13 interactions (32.5%) ‚Üí $58.50
Total:               40 interactions ‚Üí $180.00

PAYMENT SENT:
‚úÖ Your wallet:      $67.50 in SOL ‚Üí 7xK9...
Transaction ID:      [Solscan link]
```

---

## Key Takeaways

### üí∞ Fair distribution = motivated team
Work more ‚Üí earn more. Work less ‚Üí earn less. No politics.

### ‚ö° Real-time visibility = no surprises
You always know exactly what you'll earn before the job completes.

### ‚úÖ Quality gates protect everyone
Sofia catches bugs before client sees them. Better for reputation and earnings.

### üåç PPP advantage is massive
Your earnings go 5-10x further than nominal $ suggests (especially in Nigeria/Colombia).

### üìà Growth path is clear
Contribute more ‚Üí earn more ‚Üí build reputation ‚Üí handle bigger jobs ‚Üí earn even more.

---

## FAQ

### Q: What if I'm slower than my teammates? Will I earn less?

**A:** Yes, if you contribute fewer interactions, you'll earn less from that job. **But that's fair.** The system rewards contribution, not speed alone. If you're slower but thorough, you might contribute more interactions (asking clarifying questions, requesting more tests, etc.) and still earn a good share.

### Q: What if someone spams messages to AIs just to get more interactions?

**A:** Sofia (QA) catches low-quality work before delivery. If your interactions don't contribute to the final quality, the job fails ‚Üí everyone gets $0. You have a strong incentive to make quality contributions, not spam.

### Q: Can I see how much my teammates are earning?

**A:** Yes. Mission Deck shows everyone's interaction counts and earnings for each job. **This is deliberate.** Transparency prevents resentment and politics. Everyone knows exactly where they stand.

### Q: What if I disagree with my interaction count?

**A:** All interactions are automatically tracked by Mission Deck (blockchain-verifiable). There's no subjective judgment. If the system didn't count a message, it's because it wasn't sent from Mission Deck to an AI.

### Q: What about other work (deployments, testing, debugging)?

**A:** For now, only messages to AIs count. We chose this because it's objective, automated, and captures most of the work. As the system matures, we may add other interaction types (deployments, test runs, etc.) if they can be tracked automatically.

---

## Related Resources

**üîÑ [The Complete Mission Flow](./complete-mission-flow.md)**
Understand who does what when

**üí¨ [How to Talk to AI Citizens](./how-to-talk-to-ai-citizens.md)**
Get better output from Rafael and Sofia

---

## Questions About Compensation?

Reach out to Nicolas on Telegram (@nlr_ai) or ask in the team chat. We're committed to fair, transparent compensation that scales with contribution.

    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí```
    59‚ÜíYour share = (Your interactions / Total team interactions) √ó 30% of job value
    60‚Üí```
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí**Step 3:** You get paid when we receive money from the client (typically 21 days after delivery).
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí### What Counts as an Interaction
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí‚úÖ **Counts:**
    67‚Üí- Sending a message to Rafael (code generation requests)
    68‚Üí- Sending a message to Inna (specification questions)
    69‚Üí- Sending a message to Sofia (QA requests)
    70‚Üí- Sending a message to Emma (proposal assistance)
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí‚ùå **Does NOT count (for now):**
    73‚Üí- File uploads
    74‚Üí- Deployments
    75‚Üí- Testing actions
    76‚Üí- Messages outside Mission Deck
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí---
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí## Real Examples
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí### Example 1: Equal Contribution
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí**Job:** Build chatbot for Client ($1,000)
    85‚Üí**Team pool:** $300 (30%)
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí**Interactions:**
    88‚Üí- You: 15 messages to AIs
    89‚Üí- Teammate A: 15 messages to AIs
    90‚Üí- Teammate B: 15 messages to AIs
    91‚Üí- Total: 45 interactions
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí**Earnings:**
    94‚Üí- You: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**
    95‚Üí- Teammate A: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**
    96‚Üí- Teammate B: (15/45) √ó $300 = **$100**
    97‚Üí
    98‚ÜíEveryone contributed equally ‚Üí everyone earns equally.
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí---
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí### Example 2: You Work Harder
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí**Job:** Build chatbot for Client ($1,000)
   105‚Üí**Team pool:** $300 (30%)
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí**Interactions:**
   108‚Üí- You: 30 messages to AIs (you drove the project)
   109‚Üí- Teammate A: 10 messages to AIs
   110‚Üí- Teammate B: 5 messages to AIs
   111‚Üí- Total: 45 interactions
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí**Earnings:**
   114‚Üí- You: (30/45) √ó $300 = **$200**
   115‚Üí- Teammate A: (10/45) √ó $300 = **$67**
   116‚Üí- Teammate B: (5/45) √ó $300 = **$33**
   117‚Üí
   118‚ÜíYou worked 3x harder than Teammate A ‚Üí you earn 3x as much. **Fair.**
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí---
   121‚Üí
   122‚Üí### Example 3: Multiple Jobs Per Month
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí**Month:** 10 jobs @ $1,000 average = $10,000 total revenue
   125‚Üí**Total team pool:** $3,000 (30% √ó $10,000)
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üí**Your total interactions across all 10 jobs:** 200
   128‚Üí**Total team interactions across all 10 jobs:** 400
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí**Your monthly earnings:** (200/400) √ó $3,000 = **$1,500**
   131‚Üí
   132‚ÜíYou contributed 50% of the team's work ‚Üí you earn 50% of the team pool.
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí---
   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí## Missions: Fixed-Price Internal Work
   137‚Üí
   138‚ÜíNot all work is tied to Upwork jobs. Some work is internal (proposals, recruitment, social posts). These are called **Missions** and have fixed prices:
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí### Mission Pricing
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí- **Write Upwork proposal:** $1 per proposal
   143‚Üí- **Recruit new team member:** $10 per successful hire
   144‚Üí- **Post about ScopeLock on X:** $2 per post
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí**How missions are funded:** 5% of every job's value goes into a "mission fund" that pays for these internal tasks.
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí**Example:**
   149‚Üí```
   150‚ÜíJob: $1,000
   151‚ÜíMission fund: $50 (5%)
   152‚Üí
   153‚ÜíThis $50 pays for:
   154‚Üí- 5 proposals written ($5)
   155‚Üí- 1 recruitment ($10)
   156‚Üí- 10 X posts ($20)
   157‚ÜíTotal spent: $35
   158‚ÜíRemaining: $15 (rolls over to next job)
   159‚Üí```
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí---
   162‚Üí
   163‚Üí## Total Compensation Breakdown Per Job
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí**When a $1,000 Upwork job completes:**
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí```
   168‚Üí100% Client Payment: $1,000
   169‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 30% ‚Üí Team Pool ($300) ‚Äî split by interactions
   170‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 5% ‚Üí Mission Fund ($50) ‚Äî pays for missions
   171‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ 10% ‚Üí Upwork fees ($100)
   172‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ ~21% ‚Üí AI costs ($210) ‚Äî Claude API, tools
   173‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ ~34% ‚Üí ScopeLock profit ($340)
   174‚Üí```
   175‚Üí
   176‚Üí**You earn from:**
   177‚Üí1. **Team pool:** Your share of the 30% based on interactions
   178‚Üí2. **Missions completed:** Fixed $ per mission (funded from 5% mission fund)
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí---
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí## Mission Deck: Real-Time Earnings Display
   183‚Üí
   184‚ÜíThe Mission Deck shows you exactly what you'll earn, updated in real-time:
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí### Left Panel: JOBS Section
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üí```
   189‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ JOBS ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   190‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   191‚Üí‚îÇ [JOB CARD]                              ‚îÇ
   192‚Üí‚îÇ Build AI Chatbot - TherapyKin          ‚îÇ
   193‚Üí‚îÇ Client: TherapyKin                      ‚îÇ
   194‚Üí‚îÇ Value: $1,500                           ‚îÇ
   195‚Üí‚îÇ Team pool: $450 (30%)                   ‚îÇ
   196‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   197‚Üí‚îÇ Your interactions: 12                   ‚îÇ ‚Üê Updates live
   198‚Üí‚îÇ Team total: 45                          ‚îÇ
   199‚Üí‚îÇ Earning at job completion: $120.00      ‚îÇ ‚Üê (12/45) √ó $450
   200‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   201‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   202‚Üí```
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí### Left Panel: MISSIONS Section
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üí```
   207‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ MISSIONS ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   208‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   209‚Üí‚îÇ [MISSION CARD]                          ‚îÇ
   210‚Üí‚îÇ Write proposal for "AI Dashboard"       ‚îÇ
   211‚Üí‚îÇ Complete this mission: +$1.00           ‚îÇ ‚Üê Fixed amount
   212‚Üí‚îÇ Status: Available                       ‚îÇ
   213‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   214‚Üí‚îÇ [CLAIM MISSION]                         ‚îÇ
   215‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   216‚Üí```
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí### Top Banner: Total Potential Earnings
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí```
   221‚Üí‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
   222‚Üí‚ïë  YOUR TOTAL POTENTIAL EARNINGS: $342.50          ‚ïë
   223‚Üí‚ïë  (From 3 active jobs + 5 completed missions)     ‚ïë
   224‚Üí‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
   225‚Üí```
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí**This updates every time you send a message to an AI.** You always know exactly where you stand.
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí---
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí## When Do You Get Paid?
   232‚Üí
   233‚Üí**Answer: When we receive payment from the client.**
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí### Timeline
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí```
   238‚ÜíDay 0:  Job starts
   239‚Üí   ‚Üì
   240‚ÜíDay 7:  AC Green delivered to client
   241‚Üí   ‚Üì
   242‚ÜíDay 21: Upwork releases funds to ScopeLock
   243‚Üí   ‚Üì
   244‚ÜíDay 21: You get paid (SOL) ‚Äî within 4 hours
   245‚Üí```
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí### Payment Method: Solana (SOL)
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí- ‚úÖ Instant transfers
   250‚Üí- ‚úÖ Near-zero fees (~$0.01)
   251‚Üí- ‚úÖ Fully transparent on blockchain
   252‚Üí- ‚úÖ You can hold SOL, convert to USDC, or cash out to local currency via Binance
   253‚Üí
   254‚Üí---
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí## Why This System Is Better
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí### Old System (Fixed Roles)
   259‚Üí‚ùå Kara always gets 15%, even if he barely contributes
   260‚Üí‚ùå Reanance always gets 9%, even if she works overtime
   261‚Üí‚ùå Bigbosexf always gets 6%, even if he finds 20 jobs this month
   262‚Üí‚ùå No incentive to contribute more
   263‚Üí‚ùå Resentment builds when effort isn't rewarded
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí### New System (Per-Interaction)
   266‚Üí‚úÖ Work 2x as hard ‚Üí earn 2x as much
   267‚Üí‚úÖ Real-time visibility into earnings
   268‚Üí‚úÖ 100% transparent (everyone sees everyone's contribution)
   269‚Üí‚úÖ Natural incentive to contribute more
   270‚Üí‚úÖ Fair distribution based on actual work
   271‚Üí
   272‚Üí---
   273‚Üí
   274‚Üí## Quality Gates & Penalties
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí### ‚ö†Ô∏è Sofia finds critical bugs
   277‚Üí**Commission held** until bugs fixed and re-verified
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí### ‚ùå Client rejects delivery
   280‚Üí**No commission** until client accepts (AC.md not met)
   281‚Üí
   282‚Üí### üí• Job fails entirely
   283‚Üí**$0 for everyone** (ScopeLock absorbs loss)
   284‚Üí
   285‚Üí**This is why quality matters.** You only get paid when the client accepts. Rushing and shipping broken code = delayed payment or no payment.
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí---
   288‚Üí
   289‚Üí## Real-World Math: What Does This Actually Mean?
   290‚Üí
   291‚Üí### Example: You contribute to 10 jobs in a month
   292‚Üí
   293‚Üí**Assumptions:**
   294‚Üí- Average job value: $800
   295‚Üí- Your interactions: 50% of team total (you're very active)
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí**Calculation:**
   298‚Üí```
   299‚ÜíTotal revenue: 10 √ó $800 = $8,000
   300‚ÜíTeam pool: $8,000 √ó 30% = $2,400
   301‚Üí
   302‚ÜíYour share (50% of interactions):
   303‚Üí$2,400 √ó 50% = $1,200/month
   304‚Üí```
   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí**Plus missions:**
   307‚Üí- 10 proposals written: $10
   308‚Üí- 5 X posts: $10
   309‚Üí- Total missions: $20
   310‚Üí
   311‚Üí**Your total monthly earnings: $1,220**
   312‚Üí
   313‚Üí**In local currency (Nigeria):**
   314‚Üí- $1,220 √ó 1,650 NGN/USD = ‚Ç¶2,013,000/month
   315‚Üí- That's ~2x median software developer salary in Lagos
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí**Purchasing power equivalent:** ~$6,000-12,000/month in US terms
   318‚Üí
   319‚Üí---
   320‚Üí
   321‚Üí## Transparency & Tracking
   322‚Üí
   323‚ÜíAfter each job completes, Mission Deck shows payment breakdown:
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí### Example: Job #47 Payment Breakdown
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí```
   328‚Üíüìä Job #47 Payment Breakdown
   329‚Üí
   330‚ÜíJob:                 Build OpenAI chatbot
   331‚ÜíClient paid:         $600
   332‚ÜíDate:                2025-11-05
   333‚ÜíTeam pool:           $180 (30%)
   334‚Üí
   335‚ÜíINTERACTIONS:
   336‚Üí‚úÖ You:              15 interactions (37.5%) ‚Üí $67.50
   337‚Üí‚úÖ Teammate A:       12 interactions (30.0%) ‚Üí $54.00
   338‚Üí‚úÖ Teammate B:       13 interactions (32.5%) ‚Üí $58.50
   339‚ÜíTotal:               40 interactions ‚Üí $180.00
   340‚Üí
   341‚ÜíPAYMENT SENT:
   342‚Üí‚úÖ Your wallet:      $67.50 in SOL ‚Üí 7xK9...
   343‚ÜíTransaction ID:      [Solscan link]
   344‚Üí```
   345‚Üí
   346‚Üí---
   347‚Üí
   348‚Üí## Key Takeaways
   349‚Üí
   350‚Üí### üí∞ Fair distribution = motivated team
   351‚ÜíWork more ‚Üí earn more. Work less ‚Üí earn less. No politics.
   352‚Üí
   353‚Üí### ‚ö° Real-time visibility = no surprises
   354‚ÜíYou always know exactly what you'll earn before the job completes.
   355‚Üí
   356‚Üí### ‚úÖ Quality gates protect everyone
   357‚ÜíSofia catches bugs before client sees them. Better for reputation and earnings.
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üí### üåç PPP advantage is massive
   360‚ÜíYour earnings go 5-10x further than nominal $ suggests (especially in Nigeria/Colombia).
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí### üìà Growth path is clear
   363‚ÜíContribute more ‚Üí earn more ‚Üí build reputation ‚Üí handle bigger jobs ‚Üí earn even more.
   364‚Üí
   365‚Üí---
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí## FAQ
   368‚Üí
   369‚Üí### Q: What if I'm slower than my teammates? Will I earn less?
   370‚Üí
   371‚Üí**A:** Yes, if you contribute fewer interactions, you'll earn less from that job. **But that's fair.** The system rewards contribution, not speed alone. If you're slower but thorough, you might contribute more interactions (asking clarifying questions, requesting more tests, etc.) and still earn a good share.
   372‚Üí
   373‚Üí### Q: What if someone spams messages to AIs just to get more interactions?
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üí**A:** Sofia (QA) catches low-quality work before delivery. If your interactions don't contribute to the final quality, the job fails ‚Üí everyone gets $0. You have a strong incentive to make quality contributions, not spam.
   376‚Üí
   377‚Üí### Q: Can I see how much my teammates are earning?
   378‚Üí
   379‚Üí**A:** Yes. Mission Deck shows everyone's interaction counts and earnings for each job. **This is deliberate.** Transparency prevents resentment and politics. Everyone knows exactly where they stand.
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí### Q: What if I disagree with my interaction count?
   382‚Üí
   383‚Üí**A:** All interactions are automatically tracked by Mission Deck (blockchain-verifiable). There's no subjective judgment. If the system didn't count a message, it's because it wasn't sent from Mission Deck to an AI.
   384‚Üí
   385‚Üí### Q: What about other work (deployments, testing, debugging)?
   386‚Üí
   387‚Üí**A:** For now, only messages to AIs count. We chose this because it's objective, automated, and captures most of the work. As the system matures, we may add other interaction types (deployments, test runs, etc.) if they can be tracked automatically.
   388‚Üí
   389‚Üí---
   390‚Üí
   391‚Üí## Related Resources
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí**üîÑ [The Complete Mission Flow](./complete-mission-flow.md)**
   394‚ÜíUnderstand who does what when
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí**üí¨ [How to Talk to AI Citizens](./how-to-talk-to-ai-citizens.md)**
   397‚ÜíGet better output from Rafael and Sofia
   398‚Üí
   399‚Üí---
   400‚Üí
   401‚Üí## Questions About Compensation?
   402‚Üí
   403‚ÜíReach out to Nicolas on Telegram (@nlr_ai) or ask in the team chat. We're committed to fair, transparent compensation that scales with contribution.
   404‚Üí

{/* Header */}
‚Üê Resources

The More You Work, The More You Earn

Nov 7, 2025 ‚Ä¢ 12 min read ‚Ä¢ Team Onboarding Series #3
{/* Lead */}

"The more you work, the more you earn. And you know exactly how much."

Most agencies pay fixed salaries or hourly rates. You work hard on a project, but your teammate slacks off‚Äîyou both get paid the same. That's not fair.

ScopeLock is different: Every time you send a message to an AI from Mission Deck, you earn +1 interaction point. Your share: (Your interactions / Total interactions) √ó 30% of job value. Real-time visibility. 100% transparent. 100% fair.

Why this is cool: Work 2x as hard ‚Üí earn 2x as much. No politics, no favoritism, no arbitrary roles. Everyone sees everyone's contribution in real-time. More work = more money. Less work = less money. Fair.

{/* Key Principle */}

How It Works

Step 1: Every message to an AI from Mission Deck = +1 interaction point
Step 2: Your share = (Your interactions / Total interactions) √ó 30% team pool
Step 3: Get paid when client pays (typically 21 days after delivery)

What counts as an interaction?

‚úÖ Counts:
  • Messages to Rafael (code gen)
  • Messages to Inna (specs)
  • Messages to Sofia (QA)
  • Messages to Emma (proposals)
‚ùå Does NOT count (for now):
  • File uploads
  • Deployments
  • Testing actions
  • Messages outside Mission Deck
{/* Revenue Projector */}

Your Potential Earnings Calculator

Use the sliders below to see what you'd earn based on activity level:

{/* Currency Selector */}

Real Examples: How Fair Distribution Works

{/* Example 2 */}

üí™ You Work Harder ‚Üí You Earn More

You worked 3x harder than Teammate A ‚Üí you earn 3x as much. Fair.

{/* Commission Breakdown */}

Where Your Money Comes From

For every $1,000 job:

30% ‚Üí Team Pool (split by interactions) $300
5% ‚Üí Mission Fund (proposals, posts, recruitment) $50
10% ‚Üí Upwork fees $100
~21% ‚Üí AI costs (Claude API, tools) $210
~34% ‚Üí ScopeLock profit $340
You earn from:
  • Team pool: Your % of 30% based on interactions
  • Missions: Fixed $ per mission (proposals $1, posts $2, recruitment $10)
{/* Why This System Is Better */}

Why This System Is Better

‚ùå Old System (Fixed Roles)

  • Kara always gets 15%, even if he barely contributes
  • Reanance always gets 9%, even if she works overtime
  • No incentive to contribute more
  • Resentment builds when effort isn't rewarded

‚úÖ New System (Per-Interaction)

  • Work 2x as hard ‚Üí earn 2x as much
  • Real-time visibility into earnings
  • 100% transparent (everyone sees everyone's contribution)
  • Natural incentive to contribute more
  • Fair distribution based on actual work
{/* Payment Timing */}

When Do You Get Paid?

Day 0
Job starts
‚Üí
Day 7
AC Green delivered to client
‚Üí
Day 21
Upwork releases funds to ScopeLock
‚Üí
Day 21
You get paid (SOL) Within 4 hours
Payment method: Solana (SOL)

Instant transfers, near-zero fees (~$0.01), fully transparent on blockchain.

You can hold SOL, convert to USDC, or cash out to local currency via Binance.

{/* Quality Gates */}

Quality Gates & Penalties

‚ö†Ô∏è

Sofia finds critical bugs

Commission held until bugs fixed and re-verified

‚ùå

Client rejects delivery

No commission until client accepts (AC.md not met)

üí•

Job fails entirely

$0 for everyone (ScopeLock absorbs loss)

This is why quality matters.

You only get paid when the client accepts. Rushing and shipping broken code = delayed payment or no payment.

{/* Key Takeaways */}

Key Takeaways

üí∞
Fair distribution = motivated team

Work more ‚Üí earn more. Work less ‚Üí earn less. No politics.

‚ö°
Real-time visibility = no surprises

You always know exactly what you'll earn before the job completes.

‚úÖ
Quality gates protect everyone

Sofia catches bugs before client sees them. Better for reputation and earnings.

üåç
PPP advantage is massive

Your earnings go 5-10x further than nominal $ suggests.

üìà
Growth path is clear

Contribute more ‚Üí earn more ‚Üí build reputation ‚Üí handle bigger jobs ‚Üí earn even more.

{/* Related Resources */}

Related Resources

Get better output from Rafael and Sofia
{/* CTA */}

Questions About Compensation?

Reach out to Nicolas on Telegram (@nlr_ai) or ask in the team chat. We're committed to fair, transparent compensation that scales with contribution.

messages.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below: Analysis: Let me chronologically analyze this conversation to capture all technical details, user requests, and work performed. ## Conversation Flow Analysis ### Section 1: Session Continuation - Started with system reminders about previous work (navigation text revert + legal links added) - User request: "Please continue the conversation from where we left it off without asking the user any further questions. Continue with the last task that you were asked to work on." - I had just completed reverting navigation text from "How I Work" to "How ScopeLock Works" and adding Privacy/Terms links to footer ### Section 2: Mission Compensation System - Initial Discussion **User's detailed explanation of new system:** 1. Move from dedicated roles to flexible team (anyone can work on anything) 2. Terminology change: "Jobs" (Upwork revenue work) vs "Missions" (internal work) 3. Per-interaction compensation: Every message to AI = +1 point 4. Team pool: 30% of job value (NOT 23% as initially stated, corrected by user) 5. Mission fund: 5% of job value for internal tasks 6. Share calculation: `(Your interactions / Total interactions) √ó 30% pool` 7. Mission pricing: Proposals $1, Recruitment $10, X posts $2 8. Payment timing: When we receive money from client 9. Mission Deck UI: Two sections (JOBS + MISSIONS), real-time earnings display **User correction:** "The team pool is 30%, not 23%" **My response:** I recapped the system correctly with 30%, created `/docs/mission-compensation-system.md` (338 lines) ### Section 3: Update Compensation Structure Resources **User request:** "Ok, can you change the compensation structure resource, so the MD file and the TSX file to explain that?... and explain why it's cool. input.content:
# Proposal Activation Plan: From 0 to 20 Proposals/Week

**Created:** 2025-11-07
**Owner:** Alexis (Strategy) + Bigbosexf (Execution)
**Priority:** üî¥ CRITICAL (blocking all revenue)

---

## Current State

**Proposals sent:** 0
**Revenue:** $0
**Blocker:** No one actively hunting for Upwork jobs

**We have everything ready:**
- ‚úÖ Emma's mission selection criteria (`/citizens/emma/MISSION_SELECTION.md`)
- ‚úÖ Proposal templates (`/docs/marketing/proposal_templates/`)
- ‚úÖ Portfolio projects (Terminal Velocity, La Serenissima, TherapyKin, etc.)
- ‚úÖ New compensation system ($1 per proposal written)
- ‚ùå **Missing:** Someone executing the hunt daily

---

## Goal

**Week 1 (2025-11-07 to 2025-11-13):** 5 proposals sent (ramp-up week)
**Week 2+:** 20 proposals/week (target state)

**Win rate assumption:** 25% ‚Üí 5 jobs/week won at Week 2+
**Revenue target:** $400-1100/week ‚Üí $1,600-4,400/month

---

## Activation Protocol

### Step 1: Bigbosexf Starts Daily Hunt (TODAY)

**Time commitment:** 2 hours/day
**Process:**

1. **Morning (30 min):** Search Upwork for jobs matching Emma's criteria
   - Filter: $400-1500 budget
   - Filter: Posted <24 hours
   - Filter: Creative AI services OR simple development
   - Save 5-10 job URLs

2. **Midday (60 min):** Analyze with Emma + draft proposals
   - For each job: Ask Emma "Should we bid on this?"
   - Emma analyzes: client type, budget match, stack match, red flags
   - Emma drafts proposal using correct template
   - Bigbosexf reviews and customizes

3. **Afternoon (30 min):** Submit proposals on Upwork
   - Copy Emma's draft into Upwork
   - Adjust budget/timeline if needed
   - Submit
   - Log in `citizens/emma/leads-tracker.md`

**Compensation:** $1 per proposal submitted (paid from mission fund)

---

### Step 2: Emma Provides Daily Support

**Emma's role:**
- Analyze job posts when Bigbosexf requests
- Draft proposals matching client type (process-skeptical vs process-oriented)
- Flag red flags (unclear scope, demanding client, budget mismatch)
- Track leads in `leads-tracker.md`
- Follow up with non-responding clients after 2 weeks

**Emma does NOT:** Browse Upwork directly (humans must search/submit)

---

### Step 3: Daily Standup (15 min)

**When:** End of day (around 18:00 UTC)
**Who:** Bigbosexf + Alexis
**Format:**

```
DAILY PROPOSAL STANDUP:

Jobs found today: [X]
Proposals submitted: [X]
Emma's analysis: [brief summary of patterns]
Blockers: [any issues]
Tomorrow's target: [X proposals]
```

**Communication:** Post in Telegram using `/home/mind-protocol/scopelock/tools/telegram-send.cjs`

---

### Step 4: Weekly Review (Friday)

**Metrics to track:**
- Proposals sent this week: [X]
- Response rate: [X]%
- Interviews scheduled: [X]
- Jobs won: [X]
- Revenue won: $[X]

**Adjust strategy based on:**
- Which service types get most responses (double down)
- Which proposal templates work best (refine)
- Which budget ranges win most (optimize)

---

## Target Service Mix (Week 1)

**Prioritize creative AI services (higher margins, faster delivery):**

- 2 proposals: Voice generation (ElevenLabs)
- 1 proposal: Image generation (Ideogram)
- 1 proposal: Presentation design (Gamma)
- 1 proposal: Simple development (Next.js dashboard)

**Why this mix:**
- Creative AI services: 70-85% margin (higher profit)
- Faster delivery: 3-5 days vs 7-14 days for dev
- Less technical risk: AI tools handle complexity
- Business Buyers: More likely to hire for creative work

---

## Success Metrics

**Week 1 (2025-11-07 to 2025-11-13):**
- ‚úÖ 5 proposals sent
- ‚úÖ At least 1 response from client
- ‚úÖ Daily hunt rhythm established (Bigbosexf commits 2h/day)

**Week 2 (2025-11-14 to 2025-11-20):**
- ‚úÖ 20 proposals sent
- ‚úÖ 5+ client responses
- ‚úÖ At least 1 job won
- ‚úÖ Revenue: $400-1100

**Week 3+ (Steady State):**
- ‚úÖ 20 proposals/week
- ‚úÖ 5 jobs/week won (25% win rate)
- ‚úÖ Revenue: $1,600-4,400/month

---

## Failure Modes & Mitigation

### Failure Mode 1: Bigbosexf doesn't commit 2h/day

**Detection:** 0-1 proposals sent for 2 consecutive days
**Mitigation:**
- Alexis sends alert via Telegram
- 1-on-1 check-in: What's blocking you?
- If capacity issue: Recruit Reanance or Kara to help with hunt

### Failure Mode 2: Win rate <15% (worse than expected)

**Detection:** After 20 proposals, <3 jobs won
**Mitigation:**
- Analyze which proposals got responses (what worked)
- Refine Emma's mission selection criteria (wrong jobs?)
- A/B test proposal templates (process-skeptical vs process-oriented)
- Adjust budget positioning (too high? too low?)

### Failure Mode 3: Creative AI tools access issues

**Detection:** Win job but can't deliver (no access to Ideogram/Runway/Suno)
**Mitigation:**
- Before submitting proposal: Verify tool access
- If no access: Only bid on dev jobs (fallback to 50-60% margin)
- Budget for tool subscriptions ($50-200/month)

---

## Financial Impact

**Current runway:** [Need to calculate - not enough data yet]
**Burn rate:** ~$1,000/month (developer salaries + AI costs)

**Revenue scenarios (Week 2+ steady state):**

**Best case (30% win rate, high-margin creative AI jobs):**
- 20 proposals/week ‚Üí 6 jobs won/week
- Avg job value: $800
- Avg margin: 75%
- **Revenue: $4,800/week ‚Üí $19,200/month**
- **Profit: $3,600/week ‚Üí $14,400/month**
- **Runway: 14+ months**

**Expected case (25% win rate, mixed creative + dev jobs):**
- 20 proposals/week ‚Üí 5 jobs won/week
- Avg job value: $700
- Avg margin: 65%
- **Revenue: $3,500/week ‚Üí $14,000/month**
- **Profit: $2,275/week ‚Üí $9,100/month**
- **Runway: 9+ months**

**Worst case (15% win rate, only dev jobs):**
- 20 proposals/week ‚Üí 3 jobs won/week
- Avg job value: $600
- Avg margin: 50%
- **Revenue: $1,800/week ‚Üí $7,200/month**
- **Profit: $900/week ‚Üí $3,600/month**
- **Runway: 3-4 months (need to improve or reduce costs)**

---

## Next Actions (Immediate)

**TODAY (2025-11-07):**

1. **Bigbosexf:** Commit to 2h/day hunt starting tomorrow (2025-11-08)
   - [ ] Confirm availability via Telegram
   - [ ] Set daily calendar block (10:00-12:00 UTC or preferred time)

2. **Alexis:** Verify Bigbosexf's commitment
   - [ ] Send message: "Bigbosexf, can you commit 2h/day to Upwork hunt starting tomorrow? First proposals due by end of day Friday (3 proposals)."

3. **Emma:** Prepare for incoming requests
   - [ ] Review mission selection criteria
   - [ ] Have proposal templates ready
   - [ ] Set up leads-tracker.md structure

**TOMORROW (2025-11-08):**

1. **Bigbosexf:** First hunt session
   - [ ] Find 5-10 jobs matching Emma's criteria
   - [ ] Ask Emma to analyze top 3
   - [ ] Submit at least 1 proposal

2. **Emma:** Analyze first batch
   - [ ] Respond within 30 minutes to Bigbosexf's requests
   - [ ] Draft proposals using correct template
   - [ ] Log jobs in leads-tracker.md

3. **Alexis:** Monitor progress
   - [ ] Check for first proposal submission
   - [ ] Send encouragement message if proposal submitted
   - [ ] Alert if no proposal by end of day

---

## Communication Plan

**Daily (End of day):**
Bigbosexf posts standup in Telegram:
```
üìä Proposal Hunt Update:

Jobs found: 8
Analyzed with Emma: 3
Proposals submitted: 2
Tomorrow's target: 2 proposals

Status: On track / Behind / Blocked
```

**Weekly (Friday evening):**
Alexis posts weekly metrics in Telegram:
```
üìà Week 1 Results:

Proposals sent: 5
Responses: 2
Interviews: 1
Jobs won: 0 (expected Week 2)

Next week target: 10 proposals
Strategy adjustment: [if needed]
```

---

## Decision Log

**2025-11-07:** Plan created, awaiting Bigbosexf confirmation
**[Next decision date]:** [Record key decisions here]

---

## Resources

**For Bigbosexf:**
- Mission selection: `/citizens/emma/MISSION_SELECTION.md`
- Proposal templates: `/docs/marketing/proposal_templates/`
- Emma's workflow: `/citizens/emma/WORKFLOW.md`

### Human Team Members

**Philosophy:** Flexible roles - anyone can work on any part of the pipeline. No fixed assignments, no bottlenecks.

**Current team members:**
- **Nicolas (NLR)** - Agency lead, architecture guidance, final approvals
- **Bigbosexf** - Telegram: @Bigbosefx2
- **Reanance** - Telegram: @ReananceGlobal
- **Kara** - Telegram: @kara339

**Work distribution:**
- Find Upwork jobs and write proposals (with Emma's assistance)
- Write specifications and documentation (with Inna's assistance)
- Implement code and deploy (with Rafael's code generation)
- Test and verify quality (with Sofia's test suite)
- Manage client communication (with Maya's guidance)

**Compensation:** Per-interaction model - every message to AI = +1 point, earn proportional share of 30% team pool. See `/docs/resources/compensation-structure.md` for details.

**Key principle:** Work more ‚Üí earn more. Work less ‚Üí earn less. 100% transparent, real-time earnings visibility.

     3‚Üí**Target audience:** Nigerian and Colombian developers joining ScopeLock

    14‚Üí- **WHO** to ask when stuck

    20‚Üí**This guide shows the complete flow** from "job posted on Upwork" to "client paid, testimonial received."
    21‚Üí

    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí## The Big Picture: 5 Phases
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí```
    27‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    28‚Üí‚îÇ 1. ACQUIRE  ‚îÇ ‚Üí ‚îÇ 2. SPECIFY   ‚îÇ ‚Üí ‚îÇ 3. BUILD  ‚îÇ ‚Üí ‚îÇ 4. TEST ‚îÇ ‚Üí ‚îÇ 5. DELIVER‚îÇ
    29‚Üí‚îÇ  (~2 min)   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ (PLACEHOLDER)‚îÇ   ‚îÇ (2-5 days)‚îÇ   ‚îÇ(2-4 hrs)‚îÇ   ‚îÇ  (~1 day) ‚îÇ
    30‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
    31‚Üí     ‚Üì                   ‚Üì                  ‚Üì              ‚Üì             ‚Üì
    32‚Üí Find & Propose    Lock the Scope    Code & Deploy    QA Check    Client Accept

    35‚Üí**Key insight:** Each phase has a **clear owner**, **AI support**, and **handoff criteria**.
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí---
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí## Phase 1: ACQUIRE (~2 minutes)
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí### Owner: Bigbosexf ("The Hunter")
    42‚Üí### AI Support: Emma ("The Scout")
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí### The Flow
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí**Step 1: Search & Filter (Bigbosexf)**
    47‚Üí1. Open Upwork, search for jobs matching our criteria
    48‚Üí2. Copy entire results page
    49‚Üí3. Paste to Emma (via Claude Code): `"Emma, analyze these jobs"`
    50‚Üí
    51‚Üí**Step 2: Emma's Analysis (AI, instant)**
    52‚Üí- Emma reads all job posts
    53‚Üí- Returns: `"3 NO-GO (reasons), 2 STRONG GO (confidence scores)"`
    54‚Üí- Provides brief rationale for each decision
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**Step 3: Deep Dive (Bigbosexf)**
    57‚Üí- Open each STRONG GO job
    58‚Üí- Copy ENTIRE job description (don't summarize!)
    59‚Üí- Paste to Emma: `"Emma, write proposal for this job"`
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí**Step 4: Emma Generates Complete Proposal Package (AI, ~60 seconds)**
    62‚ÜíEmma produces:
    63‚Üí- ‚úÖ Full proposal text (plain text, ready to paste)
    64‚Üí- ‚úÖ Answers to client questions

    66‚Üí- ‚úÖ Telegram notification to team
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí**Step 5: Send (Bigbosexf)**
    69‚Üí- Review Emma's proposal (30 seconds)
    70‚Üí- Copy-paste into Upwork
    71‚Üí- Submit!
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí### Duration: ~2 minutes per proposal
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí### What You Receive (As Bigbosexf)

    78‚Üí```

    81‚ÜíLanding Page for SaaS Product

    83‚Üíüí∞ $400-600 (bid: $500)
    84‚Üíüë§ $12,500 spent ‚Ä¢ 4.9‚òÖ ‚Ä¢ 15 hires ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ verified

    86‚Üíüé≠ Type: process-skeptical
    87‚Üí

    89‚Üí[Full text here, ready to paste]

    91‚Üíüîó [Job URL]

    93‚Üí
    94‚ÜíüìÑ **Files created:**

    96‚Üí- `/citizens/emma/proposals/2025-11-05_upwork_saas-landing-page.json`
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí### When to Escalate
    99‚Üí- ‚ùå **DON'T escalate:** Emma says NO-GO ‚Üí Trust her, move on
   100‚Üí- ‚úÖ **DO escalate:** Client responds with technical question you can't answer ‚Üí Telegram NLR

   102‚Üí---
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí## Phase 2: SPECIFY (Duration: PLACEHOLDER - Details TBD)
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí### Owner: Reanance ("The Specifier")
   107‚Üí### AI Support: Inna ("The Specifier")
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí### The Flow
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí**[PLACEHOLDER - Multi-step process being documented]**
   112‚Üí
   113‚ÜíThis phase involves:
   114‚Üí1. Client onboarding (with Maya's guidance)
   115‚Üí2. Requirements gathering
   116‚Üí3. Writing complete specifications with Inna (6 levels: PATTERN ‚Üí BEHAVIOR_SPEC ‚Üí VALIDATION ‚Üí MECHANISM ‚Üí ALGORITHM ‚Üí GUIDE)
   117‚Üí4. Locking scope via AC.md baseline
   118‚Üí5. Creating DoD (Definition of Done) checklist
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí### What Gets Produced

   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí---
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí## Phase 3: BUILD (2 days simple, 5 days complex)
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí### Owner: Kara ("The Builder")
   136‚Üí### AI Support: Rafael ("The Guide")
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí### The Flow
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí**Step 1: Read Specs (Kara, 30 min)**
   141‚Üí- Read Reanance's complete specs
   142‚Üí- Check AC.md (what must work)
   143‚Üí- Check DoD checklist (how we verify it works)
   144‚Üí- Review architecture notes
   145‚Üí- Check deployment guide
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí**Step 2: Generate Code (Rafael, AI, instant)**
   148‚Üí
   149‚ÜíKara asks Rafael via Claude Code:
   150‚Üí```

   152‚Üí/path/to/specs/AC.md"

   154‚Üí

   159‚Üí- ‚úÖ Configuration (.env.example)
   160‚Üí- ‚úÖ Deployment instructions
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí**Step 3: Review & Test Locally (Kara, 2-4 hours)**
   163‚Üí- Create project from Rafael's code
   164‚Üí- Install dependencies
   165‚Üí- Run locally
   166‚Üí- Test against AC.md criteria
   167‚Üí- Fix any obvious issues
   168‚Üí
   169‚Üí**Step 4: Deploy (Kara, 1-2 hours)**
   170‚Üí- Deploy to Vercel (frontend) or Render (backend)
   171‚Üí- Configure environment variables
   172‚Üí- Test deployed version
   173‚Üí- Verify all AC.md criteria pass on production
   174‚Üí
   175‚Üí**Step 5: Update SYNC.md (Kara)**
   176‚Üí```markdown
   177‚Üí## 2025-11-05 14:30 - Kara: Mission #47 Deployed
   178‚Üí

   180‚Üí**URL:** https://client-project.vercel.app

   182‚Üí**Next:** Bigbosexf QA testing
   183‚Üí**Link:** /citizens/kara/missions/047-saas-landing/
   184‚Üí```
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí### Duration
   187‚Üí- **Simple (landing page, bot):** 2 days
   188‚Üí- **Medium (CRUD dashboard, API integration):** 3-4 days
   189‚Üí- **Complex (multi-feature app):** 5 days
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí### When to Escalate
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí**If stuck >1 hour:**
   194‚Üí1. Try asking Rafael first: `"Rafael, I'm getting this error: [paste error]. I tried [X]. What should I do?"`
   195‚Üí2. If still stuck after Rafael's guidance ‚Üí **Telegram NLR** (include error, what you tried, Rafael's suggestion)
   196‚Üí3. If truly urgent/blocking ‚Üí **Call NLR**
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí**Common issues Rafael can fix:**
   199‚Üí- ‚úÖ Deployment errors
   200‚Üí- ‚úÖ Environment variable configuration
   201‚Üí- ‚úÖ API integration issues

   207‚Üí## Phase 4: TEST (2-4 hours)
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí### Owner: Bigbosexf ("The Hunter" + QA)
   210‚Üí### AI Support: Sofia ("The Checker")
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí### The Flow
   213‚Üí
   214‚Üí**Step 1: Receive Handoff (Bigbosexf)**
   215‚Üí

   219‚Üí

   221‚Üí```

   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí### Duration: 2-4 hours
   253‚Üí- Simple: 2 hours
   254‚Üí- Complex: 4 hours
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí### Bug Fix Loop
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí```
   259‚ÜíBigbosexf finds bug

   267‚ÜíBigbosexf re-tests ONLY the fixed part

   273‚Üí### When to Escalate
   274‚Üí- ‚ùå **DON'T escalate:** Bug found ‚Üí Talk to Kara directly
   275‚Üí- ‚úÖ **DO escalate:** Bug is critical AND Kara can't fix in 2 hours ‚Üí Telegram NLR
   276‚Üí
   277‚Üí---
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí## Phase 5: DELIVER (~1 day)
   280‚Üí
   281‚Üí### Owner: Reanance ("The Specifier")
   282‚Üí### AI Support: Maya ("The Bridge")
   283‚Üí
   284‚Üí### The Flow
   285‚Üí

   287‚Üí

   300‚Üí**Step 2: Present to Client (Reanance, 30 min call)**

   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí**Step 3: NLR Final Review (NLR, 15 min)**

   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí**Step 4: Client Accepts**
   313‚Üí- [PLACEHOLDER: Payment flow details TBD]
   314‚Üí- [PLACEHOLDER: Team payment distribution TBD]
   315‚Üí
   316‚Üí**Step 5: Post-Delivery Check-in (Reanance + Maya, 1 week later)**
   317‚Üí

   319‚Üí```

   332‚Üí### Duration: ~1 day (including waiting for client response)
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí### When to Escalate
   335‚Üí- ‚úÖ **DO escalate:** Client unhappy/requests major changes ‚Üí Telegram NLR immediately
   336‚Üí- ‚úÖ **DO escalate:** Client requests scope change ‚Üí Reanance decides Swap/Add (unless unsure, then ask NLR)

   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí## SYNC.md Update Triggers
   341‚Üí
   342‚ÜíUpdate SYNC.md **after any significant event**, not daily. "Significant" means:
   343‚Üí
   344‚Üí‚úÖ **DO update:**

   354‚Üí- Payment received
   355‚Üí- **Blocked >1 hour**

   359‚Üí- Minor progress updates
   360‚Üí- Daily check-ins
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí**Rule:** Every 1-2 meaningful messages, update SYNC.md
   363‚Üí
   364‚Üí---

   366‚Üí## Decision Points Reference
   367‚Üí
   368‚Üí### "Who do I ask?"
   369‚Üí
   370‚Üí| Situation | Ask | Why |
   371‚Üí|-----------|-----|-----|
   372‚Üí| Stuck on code error <1 hour | Rafael (AI) | He debugs instantly |
   373‚Üí| Stuck on code error >1 hour | NLR (Telegram/Call) | Need human guidance |
   374‚Üí| Bug found in QA | Kara directly | She's the implementer |
   375‚Üí| Client question (technical) | Rafael or NLR | Depends on complexity |
   376‚Üí| Client question (scope/timeline) | Reanance handles (with Maya's help) | Reanance owns client relationship |
   377‚Üí| Client requests change | Reanance decides Swap/Add | Unless unclear, then NLR |
   378‚Üí| Should I take this job? | Emma (AI) | She evaluates fit |
   379‚Üí| How should I price this? | Alexis (AI) | She guides pricing strategy |
   380‚Üí| How do I write specs? | Inna (AI) | She generates complete docs |
   381‚Üí| Is this ready for delivery? | Sofia (AI) | She verifies DoD |
   382‚Üí
   383‚Üí---
   384‚Üí
   385‚Üí## Common Failure Modes & How to Avoid
   386‚Üí
   387‚Üí### Failure Mode 1: "I Don't Know What to Do Next"
   388‚Üí**Symptom:** Finished a phase, not sure who to hand off to
   389‚Üí**Fix:** Check the phase diagram at top ‚Üí See next phase owner ‚Üí Update SYNC.md with handoff
   390‚Üí
   391‚Üí### Failure Mode 2: "I'm Stuck and Wasting Time"
   392‚Üí**Symptom:** Been stuck >1 hour, haven't asked for help
   393‚Üí**Fix:**
   394‚Üí1. Try Rafael first (ask specific question with error/context)
   395‚Üí2. Still stuck after 30 min? ‚Üí Telegram NLR
   396‚Üí3. Urgent? ‚Üí Call NLR
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí### Failure Mode 3: "Client Changed Requirements Mid-Mission"
   399‚Üí**Symptom:** Client wants something different from AC.md
   400‚Üí**Fix:**
   401‚Üí1. Reanance decides: is this Swap (equal/lower complexity, ‚Ç¨0) or Add (new milestone, priced)?
   402‚Üí2. If Swap: Update AC.md, continue
   403‚Üí3. If Add: Create new milestone, get client approval, schedule separately
   404‚Üí4. If unsure which: Telegram NLR
   405‚Üí
   406‚Üí### Failure Mode 4: "QA Found Critical Bug Right Before Delivery"
   407‚Üí**Symptom:** Bug breaks core functionality, delivery is tomorrow
   408‚Üí**Fix:**
   409‚Üí1. Bigbosexf talks to Kara immediately (don't wait)
   410‚Üí2. Kara asks Rafael for fix
   411‚Üí3. If fixable in <2 hours: fix, re-test, deliver
   412‚Üí4. If not fixable quickly: Telegram NLR + postpone delivery 1 day
   413‚Üí
   414‚Üí---

   557‚Üí## Quiz: Test Your Understanding
   558‚Üí
   559‚Üí**Scenario 1:** You're Kara. You deployed the app but get a weird error you've never seen. You've been stuck for 45 minutes. What do you do?
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí<details>
   562‚Üí<summary>Show Answer</summary>
   563‚Üí
   564‚Üí**Correct action:**
   565‚Üí1. Ask Rafael with specific context: "Rafael, I'm getting this error: [paste error]. I tried [X and Y]. What should I do?"
   566‚Üí2. If Rafael's solution doesn't work after 30 min ‚Üí Telegram NLR with: error, what you tried, Rafael's suggestion
   567‚Üí
   568‚Üí**Why:** Rafael can debug most issues instantly. Only escalate to NLR if Rafael can't solve it.
   569‚Üí</details>
   570‚Üí
   571‚Üí---
   572‚Üí
   573‚Üí**Scenario 2:** You're Bigbosexf doing QA. You find a bug where the contact form doesn't send emails. What do you do?
   574‚Üí
   575‚Üí<details>
   576‚Üí<summary>Show Answer</summary>
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí**Correct action:**
   579‚Üí1. Screenshot the bug
   580‚Üí2. Write reproduction steps
   581‚Üí3. Talk directly to Kara (don't go through NLR or Rafael first)
   582‚Üí4. Kara will fix (with Rafael's help if needed)
   583‚Üí5. Kara will let you know when to re-test
   584‚Üí
   585‚Üí**Why:** Kara is the implementer. She owns the fix. Going through NLR wastes time.
   586‚Üí</details>
   587‚Üí
   588‚Üí---
   589‚Üí
   590‚Üí**Scenario 3:** You're Reanance. Mid-implementation, the client says "Can we also add a blog section?" What do you do?
   591‚Üí
   592‚Üí<details>
   593‚Üí<summary>Show Answer</summary>
   594‚Üí
   595‚Üí**Correct action:**
   596‚Üí1. Check AC.md: Is "blog section" in scope?
   597‚Üí2. If NO ‚Üí This is a change request
   598‚Üí3. Decide: Is this Swap (replace something with blog, same complexity) or Add (new milestone)?
   599‚Üí4. If SWAP: Update AC.md, tell Kara, continue
   600‚Üí5. If ADD: Create new milestone, price it, get client approval before scheduling
   601‚Üí6. If you're unsure which ‚Üí Telegram NLR for guidance
   602‚Üí
   603‚Üí**Why:** Reanance owns scope decisions. But if unclear, NLR helps decide.
   604‚Üí</details>
   605‚Üí

   614‚Üí3. **Testing Mindset: AC Green or It Didn't Happen** - How Sofia checks your work

input.old_string:
## Phase 1: ACQUIRE (~2 minutes)

### Owner: Bigbosexf ("The Hunter")
### AI Support: Emma ("The Scout")

### The Flow

**Step 1: Search & Filter (Bigbosexf)**
1. Open Upwork, search for jobs matching our criteria
2. Copy entire results page
3. Paste to Emma (via Claude Code): `"Emma, analyze these jobs"`

**Step 2: Emma's Analysis (AI, instant)**
- Emma reads all job posts
- Returns: `"3 NO-GO (reasons), 2 STRONG GO (confidence scores)"`
- Provides brief rationale for each decision

**Step 3: Deep Dive (Bigbosexf)**
- Open each STRONG GO job
- Copy ENTIRE job description (don't summarize!)
- Paste to Emma: `"Emma, write proposal for this job"`

**Step 4: Emma Generates Complete Proposal Package (AI, ~60 seconds)**
Emma produces:
- ‚úÖ Full proposal text (plain text, ready to paste)
- ‚úÖ Answers to client questions
- ‚úÖ Metadata JSON (budget, timeline, client info)
- ‚úÖ Telegram notification to team

**Step 5: Send (Bigbosexf)**
- Review Emma's proposal (30 seconds)
- Copy-paste into Upwork
- Submit!

### Duration: ~2 minutes per proposal

### What You Receive (As Bigbosexf)

## Phase 4: TEST (2-4 hours)

### Owner: Bigbosexf ("The Hunter" + QA)
### AI Support: Sofia ("The Checker")

### The Flow

**Step 1: Receive Handoff (Bigbosexf)**

Kara updates SYNC.md ‚Üí Bigbosexf sees notification

**Step 2: Get QA Checklist (Bigbosexf + Sofia)**

Ask Sofia via Claude Code:
```
"Sofia, verify Mission #47 ready for delivery. Specs at
/path/to/specs/AC.md"
```

Sofia returns:
- ‚úÖ DoD checklist from Reanance's specs
- ‚úÖ AC.md criteria to verify
- ‚úÖ Performance thresholds to check
- ‚úÖ Test URLs and credentials

**Step 3: Manual Testing (Bigbosexf, 1-2 hours)**
- Test every AC.md criterion
- Try to break it (edge cases)
- Check mobile responsiveness
- Verify performance (fast enough?)
- Test error handling

**Step 4: Document Findings**

**If bugs found:**
- Screenshot the bug
- Write clear reproduction steps
- Update SYNC.md with findings
- **Talk directly to Kara** (not NLR, not Rafael)

**If all passes:**
- Update SYNC.md: "QA passed ‚úÖ"
- Screenshot proof of working features
- Sign off DoD checklist

### Duration: 2-4 hours
- Simple: 2 hours
- Complex: 4 hours

### Bug Fix Loop

```
Bigbosexf finds bug
    ‚Üì
Talks to Kara (in-person or Telegram)
    ‚Üì
Kara fixes (with Rafael's help if needed)
    ‚Üì
Kara deploys fix
    ‚Üì
Bigbosexf re-tests ONLY the fixed part
    ‚Üì
If still broken: repeat
If fixed: continue QA
```

### When to Escalate
- ‚ùå **DON'T escalate:** Bug found ‚Üí Talk to Kara directly
- ‚úÖ **DO escalate:** Bug is critical AND Kara can't fix in 2 hours ‚Üí Telegram NLR

## Decision Points Reference

### "Who do I ask?"

| Situation | Ask | Why |
|-----------|-----|-----|
| Stuck on code error <1 hour | Rafael (AI) | He debugs instantly |
| Stuck on code error >1 hour | NLR (Telegram/Call) | Need human guidance |
| Bug found in QA | Kara directly | She's the implementer |
| Client question (technical) | Rafael or NLR | Depends on complexity |
| Client question (scope/timeline) | Reanance handles (with Maya's help) | Reanance owns client relationship |
| Client requests change | Reanance decides Swap/Add | Unless unclear, then NLR |
| Should I take this job? | Emma (AI) | She evaluates fit |
| How should I price this? | Alexis (AI) | She guides pricing strategy |
| How do I write specs? | Inna (AI) | She generates complete docs |
| Is this ready for delivery? | Sofia (AI) | She verifies DoD |

input.old_string:
### Failure Mode 3: "Client Changed Requirements Mid-Mission"
**Symptom:** Client wants something different from AC.md
**Fix:**
1. Reanance decides: is this Swap (equal/lower complexity, ‚Ç¨0) or Add (new milestone, priced)?
2. If Swap: Update AC.md, continue
3. If Add: Create new milestone, price it, get client approval before scheduling
4. If unsure which: Telegram NLR

### Failure Mode 4: "QA Found Critical Bug Right Before Delivery"
**Symptom:** Bug breaks core functionality, delivery is tomorrow
**Fix:**
1. Bigbosexf talks to Kara immediately (don't wait)
2. Kara asks Rafael for fix
3. If fixable in <2 hours: fix, re-test, deliver
4. If not fixable quickly: Telegram NLR + postpone delivery 1 day

## 2025-11-07 19:00 ‚Äî Alexis: Removed Fixed Human Roles (Enable Flexible Team) ‚úÖ

- Reanance = "The Specifier" (Documentation & Client Relations) - fixed assignment
- Kara = "The Builder" (Development) - fixed assignment

**Status:** Documentation complete. Team can now pick up any mission phase based on availability and interest.

**Impact:** Eliminates single-person blockers. Enables faster scaling (anyone can be trained on any part).

‚Äîalexis@scopelock

Done! I've removed all fixed human role assignments to enable the flexible team model:

**Changes made:**

1. **`/citizens/CLAUDE.md`** - Replaced the detailed "Humans" section (Bigbosexf/Reanance/Kara with fixed roles) with a simple flexible team description:
   - Lists current team members with Telegram handles only
   - States "anyone can work on any part of the pipeline"
   - References the per-interaction compensation model

2. **`/docs/resources/complete-mission-flow.md`** - Removed all specific names throughout:
   - All phases now say "Owner: Any team member" 
   - Replaced "Bigbosexf" ‚Üí "Team member" or "QA team member"
   - Replaced "Reanance" ‚Üí "Team member" or "Client relations team member"
   - Replaced "Kara" ‚Üí "Team member" or "Builder"
   - Updated decision reference table with generic roles
   - Updated Day-in-the-Life example
   - Updated visual swimlane diagram
   - Updated handoff checklists

**Result:** No more bottlenecks. Anyone can pick up proposal writing, building, QA, or client relations based on availability and interest. Your earnings = your contribution (per-interaction model).

  5. Implementation Effort vs Value

  REST Polling Approach

  Gets you:
  - ‚úÖ Your own earnings update instantly
  - ‚úÖ Team totals update every 10s
  - ‚ùå No live activity feed
  - ‚ùå No real-time leaderboard
  - ‚ùå No instant notifications

  Implementation: 2 days

  ---
  WebSocket Approach

  Gets you:
  - ‚úÖ Everything from REST
  - ‚úÖ Live activity feed (see teammates working)
  - ‚úÖ Real-time leaderboard (positions change live)
  - ‚úÖ Instant notifications (mission claimed, payment
  received)
  - ‚úÖ Team velocity/streak tracking
  - ‚úÖ Competitive "live race" feeling

  Implementation: 4 days (6 backend endpoints + WebSocket
  handler)

  ---
  My Recommendation

  Go with WebSocket if you want Mission Deck to feel like:
  - A shared team workspace (not isolated individual tabs)
  - A game (leaderboards, streaks, competition)
  - Exciting (instant dopamine hits from notifications)

  Stick with REST if you just need:
  - Basic compensation tracking
  - "Good enough" updates (10s delay acceptable)
  - Simplicity over engagement

**Strategic Analysis: Real-Time Gamification Features**

You're thinking ahead, which is good! But let me give you my honest strategic opinion on timing and priorities.

---

## The Brutal Truth: Sequencing Matters

**Current State:**
- 0 proposals sent
- 0 active jobs
- 0 revenue
- 3 team members who haven't started working yet

**Your Question:** Should we build WebSocket real-time features?

**My Answer:** Not yet. Here's why:

---

## The Chicken-and-Egg Problem

**WebSocket features are amazing when:**
- ‚úÖ Multiple people working simultaneously (creates "live race" feeling)
- ‚úÖ Steady stream of activity (activity feed has content)
- ‚úÖ Regular payments (dopamine from notifications)
- ‚úÖ Established trust (people believe system works)

**But right now we have:**
- ‚ùå Zero people working (activity feed would be empty)
- ‚ùå No live races (leaderboard shows 0/0/0)
- ‚ùå No payments yet (no dopamine to deliver)
- ‚ùå Unproven system (team needs proof first)

**Result:** You'd build beautiful real-time features that display... nothing. Empty activity feeds. Static leaderboards. Zero notifications.

---

## What Actually Motivates at Each Stage

### Stage 1: Before First Payment (WHERE WE ARE NOW)

**What motivates:**
- ‚úÖ **Trust that system works** - "Will I actually get paid?"
- ‚úÖ **Clear instructions** - "What do I do first?"

## The Trap You're Falling Into

**Classic Founder Mistake:** Building gamification before there's a game to play.

## Technical Implementation (Telegram Bot)

**What you need to build:**

```javascript
// telegram-emma-bot.js
const TelegramBot = require('node-telegram-bot-api');
const Anthropic = require('@anthropic-ai/sdk');

const bot = new TelegramBot(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN, {polling: true});
const anthropic = new Anthropic({apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY});

// Load Emma's system prompt
const emmaPrompt = fs.readFileSync('/home/mind-protocol/scopelock/citizens/emma/CLAUDE.md', 'utf8');

bot.onText(/\/analyze (.+)/, async (msg, match) => {
  const jobText = match[1];
  const chatId = msg.chat.id;
  
  // Send to Claude with Emma's prompt
  const response = await anthropic.messages.create({
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4',
    max_tokens: 4096,
    system: emmaPrompt,
    messages: [{
      role: 'user',
      content: `Analyze this Upwork job:\n\n${jobText}`
    }]
  });
  
  // Send Emma's response back to Telegram
  bot.sendMessage(chatId, response.content[0].text);
});
```

**Usage:**
```
Team member in Telegram:
/analyze [paste Upwork job post]

Emma bot responds:
‚úÖ STRONG GO - $800, Verified client
[Full proposal text ready to copy]
```

**Time to build:** 4-6 hours (simple bot, no complex features)

AI-Powered Tender Automation Platform (Phase 1: Email Tender Auto-Responder)
Hourly - Expert - Est. Time: 3 to 6 months, 30+ hrs/week
Project Overview We‚Äôre developing an AI-driven tender automation platform for the construction and engineering industry. The goal of Phase 1 (current project) is to automate how companies handle inbound tenders received by email ‚Äî extracting the data, generating pricing drafts, and preparing full response packs automatically for human review and approval. This is the first stage of a two-phase system: Phase 1 ‚Äì ‚ÄúTender Auto-Responder‚Äù: Automate inbound tenders from email. Phase 2 ‚Äì ‚ÄúTender Co-Pilot‚Äù: Scan and qualify public tenders from eTenders, gov.ie, etc. Phase 1 should therefore be built modularly, so all core services (AI parsing, summarisation, pricing engine, response generation, dashboard) can be reused later in Phase 2. What We Need Built (Phase 1 MVP) Connect to an email inbox (Gmail or Microsoft Graph) and detect new tender emails. Parse attachments (PDF, DOCX, XLSX) to extract scope, deadlines, and BOQ tables. Use GPT-4/5 or similar models to summarise tender requirements and generate a draft response pack (cover letter, pricing sheet, compliance attachments). Provide a web dashboard for internal review, editing, and final approval before sending. Allow one-click send and full audit logging. The system should produce a ready-to-review response within minutes of receiving an email. Technical Direction (already outlined in detail) We have a full technical architecture document prepared ‚Äî outlining: Backend: Python (FastAPI) preferred, modular microservice design. AI: GPT-4/5 API integration for summarisation, classification, and drafting. Parsing: pdfplumber / unstructured.io / Tesseract / Textract for PDFs & tables. Database: PostgreSQL + pgvector for semantic retrieval. Frontend: React / Next.js for the review & approval dashboard. Deployment: Docker, AWS ECS or Cloud Run, CI/CD via GitHub Actions. The architecture must be clean and reusable ‚Äî System A (Tender Finder) will later feed the same backend with public tender data. Deliverables (Phase 1 MVP) Working backend to ingest and process tender emails. AI workflows for summarisation, pricing draft, and response generation. Basic web UI for reviewing, editing, and approving responses. Email send-out integration. Documentation for setup, configuration, and deployment. Ideal Candidate We‚Äôre looking for a senior full-stack or backend-focused developer experienced in building modular SaaS systems and integrating AI. Required: Strong Python (FastAPI) or Node.js (NestJS) experience. Familiar with document parsing (PDF, Word, Excel) using OCR and text extraction. Proven experience with OpenAI API / LLM pipelines. Solid database skills (PostgreSQL). Comfortable designing scalable architecture. Clear communication, documentation, and proactive problem-solving. Bonus: Experience building quotation, estimation, or ERP-like systems. Familiarity with construction or tender workflows. Future Work (Phase 2 ‚Äì Tender Finder / Co-Pilot) The chosen developer will have the first opportunity to extend the system to include: Web scraping of public tender portals (eTenders, gov.ie). AI tender scoring and qualification algorithms. Unified dashboard (‚ÄúTender Hub‚Äù) with both Finder & Responder modules. How to Apply Please include: A brief summary of similar projects you‚Äôve built (AI, parsing, or SaaS). Your preferred backend stack and reasoning for it. Example of how you would structure modularity for Phase 2. Screening Questions What‚Äôs your experience working with GPT or similar AI APIs in production systems? How would you design a parsing pipeline that can handle messy PDFs and Excel BOQs? Describe your approach to keeping Phase 1 modular so it can evolve into Phase 2. What‚Äôs your typical process for integrating Gmail/Microsoft Graph APIs for automation? Have you ever built a system that auto-generates documents (PDFs, quotes, letters) from templates? Project Duration Estimated timeline: Engagement type: Hourly or milestone-based (open to proposals). Start date: Immediate.

# Compensation Structure: The More You Work, The More You Earn

## Why This Is Cool

**The more you work, the more you earn. And you know exactly how much.**

Most agencies pay fixed salaries or hourly rates. You work hard on a project, 
but your teammate slacks off‚Äîyou both get paid the same. That's not fair.

**ScopeLock is different:**
- Every time you send a message to an AI (Rafael, Inna, Sofia, Emma) from 
  Mission Deck, you earn +1 interaction point
- Your share of the job: `(Your interactions / Total team interactions) √ó 30% 
  of job value`
- **Real-time visibility:** You see your potential earnings update live as you work
- **100% fair:** More contribution = more money. Less contribution = less money.

**Example:**
```
Upwork Job: $1,000
Team pool: $300 (30%)

You: 20 interactions
Teammate: 10 interactions
Total: 30 interactions

Your earnings: (20/30) √ó $300 = $200
Teammate earnings: (10/30) √ó $300 = $100

You worked 2x as hard ‚Üí you earn 2x as much. Fair.
```
```

// New state variables
const [jobsPerMonth, setJobsPerMonth] = useState(10);
const [avgJobValue, setAvgJobValue] = useState(800);
const [yourInteractionPct, setYourInteractionPct] = useState(50); // % of team interactions

// Earnings calculation
const totalRevenue = jobsPerMonth * avgJobValue;
const teamPool = totalRevenue * 0.30; // 30% to team
const missionFund = totalRevenue * 0.05; // 5% for missions

// Your share based on interaction %
const yourJobEarnings = teamPool * (yourInteractionPct / 100);

// Estimate missions completed
const estimatedProposals = Math.floor(jobsPerMonth * (yourInteractionPct / 100) * 0.8);
const estimatedPosts = Math.floor((yourInteractionPct / 100) * 5);
const yourMissionEarnings = (estimatedProposals * 1) + (estimatedPosts * 2);

const yourTotalEarnings = yourJobEarnings + yourMissionEarnings;
```

FastAPI + Claude Expert | 7+ Production Integrations | Railway Deployments

---

Hi,

I've built this exact stack (FastAPI + Claude + Supabase + Railway) in production 5+ times. Can deliver by Dec 7th with room to spare.

**Relevant experience:**

**Claude API integrations:**
- Built 7+ production systems using Claude API (chat, structured outputs, function calling)
- TherapyKin.ai: FastAPI backend + Claude for AI therapy conversations (121+ deployments)
- La Serenissima: 130+ agents using Claude for multi-agent coordination
- Terminal Velocity: AI code generation with Claude integration

**FastAPI + Supabase:**
- Built 5+ FastAPI backends connected to Supabase/PostgreSQL
- RESTful APIs with Pydantic validation, async patterns, error handling
- OpenAPI/Swagger auto-documentation (FastAPI native)

**Railway deployments:**
- Deployed 3+ FastAPI services to Railway with CI/CD
- Environment config, logging, monitoring setup

**What I'll deliver:**

**Code:**
- FastAPI service with async endpoints (reads Supabase ‚Üí calls Claude ‚Üí parses response ‚Üí writes back)
- Pydantic models for validation (request/response schemas)
- Comprehensive error handling (Claude API failures, database errors, parsing issues)
- Structured logging (track every request, response, error)
- GitHub repo with clean commit history

**Documentation:**
- README with setup steps (local dev + Railway deploy)
- OpenAPI/Swagger docs (auto-generated by FastAPI)
- .env.example with all required variables
- Inline code documentation (docstrings, type hints)

**Deployment:**
- Railway service configured and running
- Environment variables set
- Health check endpoint
- Basic monitoring/alerting

**Timeline:**
- Week 1: Core service (database read ‚Üí Claude call ‚Üí parse ‚Üí save)
- Week 2: Error handling, logging, validation
- Week 3: Testing, docs, Railway deployment
- Week 4: Buffer for revisions
- **Target delivery: Nov 25 (2 weeks before your Dec 7 deadline)**

**Rate:** $45/hr (within your $20-50 range, mid-high for quality)

**Estimated hours:** 40-60 hours total (weekly check-ins to track progress)

**Proof:**
- GitHub: github.com/nlr-ai (65K commits, FastAPI/Python projects)
- TherapyKin: therapykin.ai (FastAPI + Claude + Supabase, live production)
- Terminal Velocity: github.com/nlr-ai/terminal-velocity (1.1k stars)

**Questions before starting:**

1. **Claude prompt complexity:** Is the prompt static or dynamic? (Single template or varies by data?)
